Title: Hollow-body abduction
Desc: The hollow-body abduction is an isometric core exercise that includes leg abductions for an added challenge to the core and abductors. It targets multiple muscles of the core, but particularly the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles. It can be performed for time or reps in the ab-focused portion of any workout.

Title: FYR Hollow Hold
Desc: "Hold a plank position with legs lifted and arms straight, engaging abdominal muscles to maintain stability. Focus on core control and endurance."

Title: Tip-toe crunch
Desc: The tip-toe crunch is a variation on the crunch exercise that involves placing the toes on or near the ground. This can help isolate the abs from the hip flexors. The tip-toe crunch can be performed for time or for reps as part of the core-focused component of any workout.

Title: Knee-to-nose pulse
Desc: The knee-to-nose pulse is a bodyweight exercise that targets the core by pulsing your knee toward your nose. It starts in a straight-arm plank position, and is similar to a mountain climber, but with a hold or pause in the bent-knee position.

Title: Plank walk-out
Desc: The plank walk-out is an advanced plank variation targeting the core and shoulders. From a standing position, the lifter descends into a plank-type position but “walks” the hands forward until they are out in front of the head. This is far more challenging to the core than having the arms directly under the shoulders. Beginners will need to progress to this exercise.

Title: FYR V-Up
Desc: The V-up is a bodyweight movement that targets the muscles of the abs, the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles in particular. It is similar to a suitcase crunch, but the lower back lifts off the ground at the top of each rep. It can be performed for time or reps in the ab-focused portion of any workout.

Title: Long sit-up
Desc: The long sit-up is an advanced version of the sit-up exercise that is performed with the hands reaching over the head. This lengthens the torso, making it harder for the abs to contract and lift the upper body. Long sit-ups can be performed for time or for reps, with the feet anchored or free.

Title: FYR Breakdancer
Desc: The side kick-through is a full-body movement that involves isometric holds and moving the body through different ranges of motion, beginning in a bear crawl position. The difference between a side kick-through and a sit-through is that your butt stays off the ground throughout the entire rep. It is commonly performed in bodyweight circuits and animal-style flows, but can also work for reps on its own or as part of a dynamic warm-up or mobility sequence.

Title: Seated leg lift
Desc: The seated leg lift is a bodyweight exercise targeting the muscles of the core and hip flexors. It can be performed for time or reps in the core-focused portion of any workout.

Title: Gorilla burpee
Desc: The gorilla burpee is a variation of the burpee exercise that consists of a reverse lunge on each leg, a full squat, then a standard burpee. It is extra challenging for the lower body, including the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can be performed for time or reps in any fat-loss or athleticism-focused circuit or workout.

Title: Knee-in to V-out
Desc: The knee-in to V-out is a bodyweight abdominal exercise performed on the floor. It is similar to both the reverse crunch and the V-up exercise, but combines elements of both. It primarily targets the muscles of the rectus abdominis, or “six-pack” muscles. It can be performed for reps or time, either as part of an ab-focused workout or as a component of a circuit workout.

Title: Bear crawl push-up
Desc: The bear crawl push-up is a variation of the bear crawl hold with a push-up added. It adds an extra coordination and shoulder challenge to an already intense full-body movement that targets the cardiovascular system as well as a wide range of muscle groups, the shoulders, core, and legs in particular. It can be done as a full-body warm-up, or as part of a bodyweight circuit or flow.

Title: FYR Front Step
Desc: "Engage core, step forward with one foot while keeping back straight and arm out for balance. Alternate sides."

Title: Plank reach
Desc: The plank reach is an exercise targeting the entire core, particularly the oblique muscles. It resembles a plank exercise, but the primary difference is that the lifter extends their arms forward, one at time. The core, especially the obliques, must work hard to maintain stability. It can be performed for time, with holds in the reaching position, or for reps.

Title: Eiffel Tower leg raise
Desc: The Eiffel Tower leg raise is a bodyweight exercise targeting the muscles of the abs, the rectus abdominis or “six-pack” muscles in particular. It is similar to a V-up, but with the added challenge of “drawing” a pyramid shape in the air with the legs during each rep. It can be performed for time or reps in the core-focused portion of any workout.

Title: Straight-arm plank
Desc: The straight-arm plank is an exercise targeting the core muscles. It is basically the top of a push-up position, with elbows fully extended and palms on the floor. The position is held for time to target the muscles of the core, as well as the shoulders.

Title: Plank up-down
Desc: The plank up-down is a variation of the plank push-up that ends in an elbow plank rather than with the chest on the ground. It involves transitioning between the two positions one arm at a time, rather than two. It puts more stress on the triceps and core than traditional planks. It can be performed for time or reps in any bodyweight workout or during the core-focused portion of any workout.

Title: Frog kick
Desc: The frog kick is an explosive bodyweight movement that involves hopping the rear legs up and forward from a straight-arm plank position. It targets the legs, core, and shoulders, but is also a high-intensity conditioning movement that will raise core body temperature and burn serious calories. It can be performed for time or reps as part of any athleticism-focused or fat-loss circuit or workout.

Title: FYR Knees to Chest
Desc: The hollow-body alternating knee-to-chest is a core exercise that involves bending the legs while holding the hips and shoulder blades off the ground. It targets the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles. It can be performed for time or reps in the ab-focused portion of any workout.

Title: Front kick-through
Desc: The front kick-through is a full-body movement that involves moving the legs from a bear crawl position to a balanced one-legged stance. It is commonly performed for reps or time in bodyweight circuits and animal-style flows, but can also work on its own or as part of a dynamic warm-up or mobility sequence.

Title: FYR Sit-Up
Desc: The sit-up is a popular bodyweight exercise focused on the abdominal muscles. It has also been used as part of military, tactical, and scholastic fitness tests for many years. It can be performed for time or reps, with the feet anchored or free, on flat ground or a bench.

Title: FYR Leg Lift
Desc: The seated leg lift is a bodyweight exercise targeting the muscles of the core and hip flexors. It can be performed for time or reps in the core-focused portion of any workout.

Title: TBS Toes-to-bar
Desc: The hanging toes-to-bar is an advanced abdominal exercise in which the lifter touches their feet to a pull-up bar. There are many ways to perform this movement: strict or swinging, arms completely straight or slightly bent, legs straight or bent, each providing unique benefits and challenges. Initially, it may be a difficult move to do for a single rep, but once you build the requisite core, lat, and shoulder strength, it can be performed for higher reps.

Title: FYR Mountain Climber
Desc: The mountain climber is a popular bodyweight exercise targeting the muscles of the core, as well as the shoulders, hips, and cardiovascular system. It involves lifting one knee to the chest at a time from a straight-arm plank position. It can be performed for time or reps as part of a dynamic warm-up, for bodyweight cardio or conditioning, or as no-equipment dynamic core training.

Title: Roman Chair Side Ups
Desc: "Hold Roman Chair's side handles, engage core, and lift legs up to 45-degree angle, squeezing abdominal muscles. Control descent, repeat."

Title: Push-Up Roll Out - Gethin Variation
Desc: "Start in a plank position, engage abs to lift torso towards the ceiling. Slowly roll shoulders forward, squeezing obliques as you descend back down."

Title: Cross-Body Crunch - Gethin Variation
Desc: The cross-body sit-up is a bodyweight exercise targeting the ab muscles, the obliques and rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles in particular. It involves bringing the opposite-side knee and elbow together, usually alternating sides with each rep. It can be performed for time or reps as part of the ab-focused portion of any workout.

Title: Decline leg lift with twist
Desc: The decline leg lift with twist is a bodyweight core exercise targeting the obliques and rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles, particularly the lower abs. It can be performed for time or for reps as part of the core-focused portion of any workout or circuit.

Title: Hanging Leg Raise - Variation Gethin
Desc: The hanging leg raise is an exercise targeting the abs and hip flexors. Instead of resting the forearms on the pads of apparatus, hang from a bar. It can be performed for time or reps in the ab-focused portion of any workout.

Title: Butterfly crunch
Desc: The butterfly crunch is a popular bodyweight exercise that targets the rectus abdominis, or "six-pack" muscles. It gets its name from the position of the elbows and knees, both of which are bent out like wings. It can be performed for time or reps as part of any abs-focused circuit or workout.

Title: Cross-body mountain climber
Desc: The cross-body mountain climber is a popular bodyweight exercise targeting the muscles of the core, as well as the shoulders, hips, and cardiovascular system. It is different from a traditional mountain climber because you bring the knee to the opposite side of the body rather than simply to the chest. It can be performed for time or reps as part of a dynamic warm-up, for bodyweight cardio or conditioning, or as no-equipment dynamic core training.

Title: Flat Bench Lying Leg Raise - Gethin Variation
Desc: The lying leg lift is a popular bodyweight exercise targeting the muscles of the abs, the rectus abdominis or “six-pack” muscles in particular. It can be performed for time or reps in the core-focused portion of any workout.

Title: Lying leg lift
Desc: The lying leg lift is a popular bodyweight exercise targeting the muscles of the abs, the rectus abdominis or “six-pack” muscles in particular. It can be performed for time or reps in the core-focused portion of any workout.

Title: Hanging alternating single-leg raise
Desc: The hanging alternating single-leg raise is an exercise targeting the abs, but which also works the lats and hip flexors. Rather than performing both legs at a time, you lift one and alternate with each rep. Leg raises are often performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps or more, as part of ab-focused training. However, this difficult variation may require some time to build up to those rep ranges.

Title: Plank Walk
Desc: "Hold a plank position, engage core, and walk your hands forward about 6-8 inches, keeping abs tight. Repeat by walking hands backward to original position."

Title: Sit-Up - Gethin Variation
Desc: The sit-up is a popular bodyweight exercise focused on the abdominal muscles. It has also been used as part of military, tactical, and scholastic fitness tests for many years. It can be performed for time or reps, with the feet anchored or free, on flat ground or a bench.

Title: Plank Push-Up
Desc: The plank up-down is a variation of the plank push-up that ends in an elbow plank rather than with the chest on the ground. It involves transitioning between the two positions one arm at a time, rather than two. It puts more stress on the triceps and core than traditional planks. It can be performed for time or reps in any bodyweight workout or during the core-focused portion of any workout.

Title: Decline crunch-
Desc: The decline crunch is a popular bodyweight exercise targeting the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles, particular the upper abs. It is usually performed for high reps, such as 10-15 reps per set or more, as part of the ab-focused portion of a workout.

Title: Alternating lying leg raise
Desc: The alternating lying leg lift is a popular bodyweight exercise targeting the muscles of the abs, the rectus abdominis or “six-pack” muscles in particular. It can be performed for time or reps in the core-focused portion of any workout.

Title: Decline leg lift
Desc: The decline leg lift is a popular bodyweight core exercise targeting the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles, particularly the lower abs. It can be performed for time or for reps as part of the core-focused portion of any workout or circuit.

Title: Crunch - Gethin Variation
Desc: The crunch is a popular core exercise targeting the rectus abdominis, or "six-pack" muscles, as well as the obliques. It has been the centerpiece of many ab-focused workouts, due to both its simplicity and the intense burn and mind-muscle connection it produces. It can be performed for time or reps as part of the ab-focused portion of any workout.

Title: Plank - Gethin Variation
Desc: The elbow plank is a popular isometric abdominal exercise. It is common in all types of exercise programs, as well as in group fitness and yoga classes. It targets the muscles of the core, the deep core or transversus abdominis in particular. It is also often prescribed for time to help back pain or to teach proper bracing.

Title: Barbell floor wiper
Desc: The barbell floor wiper is a core exercise in which the barbell is held in the locked-out position of a floor press, and the hips and legs are rotated side to side. It targets the oblique muscles of the lateral abdomen, but is also seriously challenging to the deep core and rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles.

Title: Prison Push-Up
Desc: "Assume a plank position, engage core, and lower body until chest nearly touches ground. Pause, then push back to start."

Title: McGill Modified Curl-Up
Desc: "Start in a plank position, engage core and slowly curl up towards knees while keeping back straight. Lower and repeat."

Title: Cross-body toe-touch
Desc: The cross-body toe-touch is a version of the toe-touch stretch where instead of both hands reaching down toward both feet, one hand at a time reaches for the opposing foot. It's a common component in dynamic warm-ups for training or sports, but can also be performed for simple flexibility work anytime.

Title: Toy soldier
Desc: The toy soldier is a calisthenics exercise targeting the hip flexors and legs, which are kicked up one at a time. When each leg is at the top of the kick, the opposing hand touches that foot. It's a common warm-up exercise before athletics, but can also help raise core temperature and mobilize a wide range of muscles and joints prior to training.

Title: Natural Glute Ham Raise with Stability Ball
Desc: Lying on a mat, engage core and lift glutes towards ceiling using stability ball for support. Hold for a brief moment before slowly lowering back down.

Title: Lateral ape
Desc: The lateral ape is an exercise focused on the lower body that involves staying in a low squat position as you hop laterally. It can be performed as part of a dynamic warm-up, to improve hip mobility, or as part of a fat-loss or athleticism-focused circuit workout.

Title: Hollow-body knee tuck
Desc: The hollow-body knee tuck is a bodyweight abdominal exercise performed on the floor. It is similar to both the hollow-body hold and the knee tuck or reverse crunch, combining elements of both. It primarily targets the muscles of the rectus abdominis, or “six-pack” muscles. It can be performed for reps or time, either as part of an ab-focused workout or as a component of a circuit workout.

Title: HM Air Jumping Rope
Desc: "Jump into a plank position, engage core and explosively jump off both feet while swinging arms to mimic rope rotation, targeting ab muscles."

Title: HM Alternating Lunge Reach
Desc: "Stand with feet hip-width apart, alternate lunging while reaching for opposite toe. Keep core engaged and hold for 1-2 seconds before switching sides."

Title: HM Alternating Side Plank Reach
Desc: "Hold a plank position, alternating bringing each hand to the opposite knee, engaging your core and maintaining straight body alignment."

Title: HM Superman Plank
Desc: "Hold a plank position, squeezing abs tight. Lift right arm and left leg off the ground, holding for a brief moment before returning to neutral."

Title: HM Table Pose
Desc: "Hold a straight, flat back against the floor, engage abs to support body, and maintain stability for 30-60 seconds."

Title: HM Toe Touch
Desc: "Lie on your back, engage core, and lift shoulders off ground. Reach for toes, slowly lowering body while keeping knees bent."

Title: HM Right Side Bird-Dog
Desc: "Hold a straight line from head to heels, engage core, and lift right arm and left leg off the ground, holding for 30 seconds before switching sides."

Title: HM Right Side Crunch
Desc: Lie on your back, hands behind head, lift shoulders and hips off ground, curl up to right side, squeezing abdominals, hold briefly before returning to start.

Title: HM Bicycle
Desc: Contract abdominal muscles, lift legs off floor, and pedal as if on a bicycle, focusing on controlled movements to engage obliques.

Title: HM Bird-Dog Plank
Desc: "Engage core, lift arms and legs off ground, forming a straight line from head to heels. Hold steady for 30-60 seconds."

Title: HM Boat Pose
Desc: Engage core by drawing belly button towards spine, then slowly lower torso, keeping legs straight and body in a straight line from head to heels. Hold for a few seconds before lifting back up.

Title: HM Bottoms Up
Desc: Hold a plank position, engage core and slowly lift legs straight up towards ceiling, keeping body in a straight line from head to heels.

Title: HM Bridge
Desc: "Hold a bridging position, engage core, and slowly lift hips towards ceiling while squeezing abdominals. Lower back to start, repeating the motion."

Title: HM Running Man Crunch
Desc: "Start in a plank position, engage core, then bring one knee up towards chest while maintaining straight arms and legs. Quickly switch legs, mimicking running motion."

Title: HM Seated Twist
Desc: Sit upright with knees bent and feet flat on floor, twist torso to left, stretching right arm towards left knee; repeat on opposite side.

Title: HM Side-Bend Pose
Desc: Hold a side-bending pose, engaging abdominal muscles to maintain form, and hold for 30 seconds, switching sides.

Title: HM Side-Plank Arm Wrap
Desc: Hold a side-plank position, engage abdominals. Wrap arm around knee, drawing elbow towards shoulder. Hold for 30 seconds, switch sides.

Title: HM Side-Plank with Hip Touch
Desc: "Hold side-plank position, engage core and lift hip towards ceiling, then slowly lower back down. Repeat on other side."

Title: HM Side-Plank with Kick
Desc: "Hold a side-plank position with feet hip-width apart and hands on the ground. Lift your top leg towards the ceiling, engaging your core and keeping your body straight."

Title: HM Side V-Up
Desc: "Hold a straight line from head to heels, engage abs, and lift right side towards ceiling while keeping legs extended. Hold for 1 second before slowly lowering back down."

Title: HM Crab Crunch
Desc: Start in a plank position, engage core and slowly lift left leg towards chest while rotating torso to bring elbow to knee. Switch sides.

Title: HM Cross-Over Crunch
Desc: "Hold a straight line from head to heels, engage abs, lift left shoulder towards right knee while rotating torso. Repeat on other side."

Title: HM Crunch Pulse
Desc: "Hold a plank position, then pulse lower torso towards floor while keeping abs engaged, releasing slowly. Focus on controlled movement and core contraction."

Title: HM Dead Bug
Desc: Lie on back with knees bent and feet flat, slowly lift hips towards ceiling while keeping lower back pressed into floor, focusing on controlled movement of abdominals.

Title: HM Single-Leg Inchworm
Desc: From a plank position, lift one leg off the ground and walk your hands forward while keeping your core engaged, then slowly lower yourself back down.

Title: HM Floor Jack
Desc: "Engage core, lift legs off floor, and hold for 1-2 seconds. Slowly lower back down without touching feet to ground."

Title: HM Floor Wiper
Desc: "Hold a plank position, engage core and slowly lift right leg off floor, keeping knee bent. Hold for 1 second, then lower. Alternate legs."

Title: HM Floor Kick
Desc: Lie flat, engage core, and lift right leg towards ceiling, then quickly return to starting position. Repeat on opposite side. Focus on controlled movements and core engagement.

Title: HM Sit-Up
Desc: "Hold a neutral spine, engage core, and lift torso off ground, curling up to 90 degrees; pause, then slowly lower back down."

Title: HM Slow Mountain Climber
Desc: "Hold a plank position, then bring one knee towards chest and quickly switch to the other leg in a slow, controlled motion. Alternate legs for added core engagement."

Title: HM Slow Sit-Up
Desc: "Slowly lift torso off mat, keeping back straight and abs tight, hold for 2 seconds before slowly lowering."

Title: HM Half-Up
Desc: "Hold a half-up position, engaging your core and raising your upper body towards the ceiling. Pause, then slowly lower back down."

Title: HM Hollow-Body Pulse
Desc: "Hold a hollow-body position, engage core muscles, and pulse abdominal muscles inward while maintaining a steady hold for a controlled contraction."

Title: HM Hollow Hold
Desc: "Hold a plank position with straight body, engage abs, and maintain for 30-60 seconds, keeping core muscles active to strengthen abdominals."

Title: HM Inchworm
Desc: "Hold a plank position, engage abdominals, then slowly walk hands forward while keeping legs straight, stretching and contracting core muscles."

Title: HM Right Side Hollow Hold with Pulse
Desc: "Engage your core, lift right leg off the ground and hold steady for 30 seconds. Pulse 5-6 times, then slowly return to starting position."

Title: HM Reverse Crunch with Frisbee
Desc: Lie on your back, engage core, and lift hips towards ceiling, squeezing abdominals. Hold for 2 seconds before slowly lowering.

Title: HM Left Side Bird-Dog
Desc: "Start on hands and knees, engage core, lift left arm and right leg off ground, hold for a brief moment before lowering back down. Repeat."

Title: HM Left Side Crunch
Desc: Lying on your right side, lift left leg and shoulder off ground, engaging abs to crunch up towards chest. Hold briefly, then slowly lower back down.

Title: HM Left Side Hollow Hold With Pulse
Desc: "Hold a side plank position on your left, engage core and lift legs towards ceiling. Pulse legs up and down without letting hips dip or sway."

Title: HM Reverse Crunch
Desc: "Lie on your back, engage core and lift hips towards knees, squeezing abdominals. Hold briefly then slowly lower."

Title: HM Low Lunge With External Twist And Arm Reach
Desc: "Hold a low lunge position, twisting torso and reaching for opposite hand to engage abdominals, maintaining balance and core strength."

Title: HM Mountain Climber
Desc: Start in a plank position, engage core, and bring one knee towards chest while keeping other foot on ground. Alternate legs quickly to simulate mountain climbing.

Title: HM Prison Sit-Up
Desc: "Sit on floor with knees bent and feet flat, engage core, lift torso up to 90-degree angle, hold briefly, then slowly lower back down."

Title: HM Plank Alternating Hip-Dip
Desc: "Hold a plank position, engaging abdominals. Alternate dipping one hip towards the ground while keeping abs tight, then switch sides."

Title: HM Tuck-Up Get-Up
Desc: "Hold a tucked position, then explosively propel body upwards into a get-up, engaging abdominal muscles to control movement and maintain core stability."

Title: HM Flutter Kick
Desc: "Hold a plank position, engage core and lift right leg towards ceiling in a fluttering motion. Quickly alternate legs for added abdominal challenge."

Title: HM Plank
Desc: "Hold a position with hands shoulder-width apart, engaging abdominals to support body; maintain straight line from head to heels for maximum core engagement."

Title: McGill Pull-Up
Desc: "Hang from a bar with hands shoulder-width apart, engage core, and pull up by drawing belly button towards spine, squeezing abdominals at top."

Title: AM Leg Lift
Desc: The captain's chair leg raise is an exercise that targets the abs and hip flexors. It involves an apparatus that allows the forearms to rest on pads and the upright torso to hang freely. Unlike the Captain’s chair knee raise, the legs are straight here.

Title: AM Decline Abs
Desc: The decline sit-up is a core exercise that works the iliopsoas, quads, hip flexors, and adductors. The rectus abdominis and obliques are the stabilizers in this movement.

Title: Hanging crunch
Desc: The hanging crunch an abdominal exercise that targets the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles. It can be performed hanging from a bar, on a dip station or parallel bars, or if grip strength is a limitation, by placing the elbows in ab straps. If hanging from a straight bar is uncomfortable to the wrists or shoulders, you can also perform them hanging with a neutral grip (palms facing one another). It is similar to a hanging knee raise, but with more spinal curling and a more pronounced "crunch" at the top.

Title: Tyler Holt Hanging Toes-To-Bar
Desc: "Hang from a sturdy bar, lifting legs to engage abdominals. Lift toes towards bar, then slowly lower back down, repeating the motion."

Title: Side plank
Desc: The side plank is a popular isometric abdominal exercise focusing on the oblique muscles, as well as the transversus abdominis or deep core muscles. It is sometimes paired with the curl up and bird dog as the “McGill big three” for core strength and stability. It is performed for time and can work in a warm-up or in the core-focused portion of any workout.

Title: Bird dog-
Desc: The bird dog is a core exercise designed to help strengthen and stabilize the posterior chain. It involves lifting an opposite-side arm and leg while in a bent-leg tabletop position. It is most commonly performed as part of a dynamic warm-up, or for mobility and muscle activation anytime.

Title: Single-leg curl up
Desc: The single-leg curl up is a bodyweight abdominal movement that teaches and reinforces abdominal “bracing” for strength training. It is usually performed along with variations of the bird dog and side plank as the “McGill big three.” The curl up can be performed for time or for reps, with or without pauses at the top position, as part of a warm-up or the core-focused component of any workout.

Title: Single-kettlebell windmill
Desc: The single-kettlebell windmill is a dynamic kettlebell exercise emphasizing core strength and shoulder and hip mobility and stability. It is often used as a functional warm-up or for multi-directional strength work. It doesn't work as well in a metcon or conditioning setting, and shouldn't be performed under intense fatigue.

Title: UNS Foam Roll Thigh
Desc: "Lie on back, arms extended overhead. Engage core and lift legs towards ceiling, keeping knees straight. Slowly lower and control descent."

Title: UNS Inverted row
Desc: "Hang from a bar, engaging core and keeping legs straight. Slowly lift upper body, squeezing abs at peak, then lower back down."

Title: UNS T-spine rotation with reach
Desc: From a standing position, engage abdominals and slowly twist torso to one side, reaching for toes while maintaining straight arms.

Title: UNS Quadruped thoracic rotation
Desc: "Hold a quadruped position, engage core and rotate torso to left and right, maintaining straight line from head to heels, targeting abdominal muscles."

Title: UNS Pec stretch
Desc: "From a seated position, gently pull your knees towards your chest while keeping your back straight and hold for 30 seconds to stretch the abdominals."

Title: UNS Lat stretch
Desc: "Lying on your back, bring knees towards chest and hold for 30 seconds to stretch the abdominal muscles, focusing on latissimus dorsi engagement."

Title: UNS Foam Roll
Desc: Lying on your back, engage core and slowly draw knees towards chest, then release. Repeat controlled contractions to target abdominals.

Title: UNS Foam Roll Lats
Desc: Lying on your back, engage core and slowly lift upper body using only abdominal muscles, keeping shoulders off floor to target lats.

Title: UNS Rocking Adductor Stretch
Desc: "Sit on floor with legs bent and feet flexed, engage abs to stabilize. Slowly rock forward, stretching adductors, then return to starting position."

Title: UNS Bird Dog
Desc: "Hold a plank position, lift right arm and left leg off the ground, holding for a brief moment before switching sides, engaging abdominals."

Title: UNS Jumping Jack
Desc: "Start in a plank position, explosively jump feet apart while raising arms above head, then quickly return to starting position, engaging core and abdominal muscles."

Title: Ab wheel roll-out
Desc: The ab wheel roll-out is an exercise targeting the abdominals using an inexpensive wheel device with a handle on either side. Many trainers and strength coaches claim it's one of the best exercises for developing strength in the midsection. Beginners may have to start with a limited range of motion or just wheel planks.

Title: Bench mountain climber
Desc: The bench mountain climber is a bodyweight exercise that works the core, shoulders, and lower body while burning a lot of calories. Placing the hands on an elevated surface such as a bench decreases the challenge to the shoulders, allowing lifters to focus their work on the other body parts. Mountain climber variations are usually performed at a fast pace for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per leg or more.

Title: Feet-elevated bench side plank
Desc: The feet-elevated bench side plank is an advanced version of the side plank performed with the feet elevated on a bench. It targets the same muscles as the side plank, including the obliques, shoulders, and lateral hips, but the body angle makes it more difficult than side planks on the floor. Most lifters will need to progress to this version after mastering the basic side plank first.

Title: Cross-body sit-up
Desc: The cross-body sit-up is a bodyweight exercise targeting the ab muscles, the obliques and rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles in particular. It involves bringing the opposite-side knee and elbow together, usually alternating sides with each rep. It can be performed for time or reps as part of the ab-focused portion of any workout.

Title: Decline kayak
Desc: The decline kayak is a core exercise targeting the obliques. It involves making a paddling motion on a decline bench with the feet anchored, using a bar or pipe for weight. It is usually performed for moderate to high reps, at least 8-12 reps per side, as part of the ab-focused portion of a workout or circuit.

Title: 30 Decline Reverse Crunch
Desc: The decline reverse crunch is a core exercise targeting the lower abdominals.

Title: Decline sit-up twist
Desc: The decline sit-up twist is a bodyweight core exercise that targets the obliques, as well as the rectus abdominis or "six pack" muscles. Sit-up variations are usually performed for moderate to high reps, such as 10-15 reps per set or more, as part of the core-focused portion of a workout.

Title: 30 Flat Bench Leg Raise
Desc: The lying leg lift is a popular bodyweight exercise targeting the muscles of the abs, the rectus abdominis or “six-pack” muscles in particular. It can be performed for time or reps in the core-focused portion of any workout.

Title: 30 Flutter Kick
Desc: The flutter kick is a core exercise where the legs are held off the ground as you flutter your feet over and under each other in small motions. It targets multiple muscles of the core, but particularly the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles. It can be performed for time or reps in the ab-focused portion of any workout.

Title: Chin-up crunch
Desc: The chin-up crunch is an exercise targeting the core and overall upper-body strength. It combines a chin-up with a knee raise or crunch to give extra emphasis to the core.

Title: 30 Gorilla Chin Oblique Crunch
Desc: "Start in a plank position, engage core and lift left foot off the ground. Rotate torso to bring left elbow towards right knee while keeping abs tight. Hold for a brief moment before returning to start."

Title: Half Turkish get-up
Desc: The half Turkish get-up is a kettlebell movement that focuses on the first portion of the Turkish get-up exercise. It is often taught as a precursor to the full Turkish get-up, but is also a valuable abdominal and shoulder exercise in its own right. It can be performed for reps or time, either in lower rep ranges for strength or higher rep ranges for technique practice or conditioning.

Title: 30 Hanging Oblique Crunch
Desc: The hanging oblique crunch an abdominal exercise that targets both the rectus abdominus or “six-pack” muscles, and the oblique muscles. It can be performed hanging from a bar, or if grip strength is a limitation, by placing the elbows in ab straps. If hanging from a straight bar is uncomfortable to the wrists or shoulder, you can also perform them hanging with a neutral grip (palms facing one another)

Title: 30 Hollow-Body Hold
Desc: The hollow-body hold is an isometric exercise that increases strength and stability in the core muscles. It is common in gymnastics training, CrossFit training, and as a core tension and bracing drill for lifters and athletes of all types. It is performed for time and can be performed as an activation drill prior to lifting, as part of a circuit, or as equipment-free core training anytime.

Title: Parallel bars knee raise
Desc: The parallel bars knee raise is a bodyweight exercise that targets the abs. It is performed on parallel bars, starting in the top position of a dip. Knee raises are often performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps or more, as part of ab-focused training.

Title: 30 Landmine Twist
Desc: The landmine twist is a rotational abdominal movement performed utilizing an angled barbell anchored at floor level in a landmine device. It can also be performed by sticking a barbell in the corner of a room, preferably in a towel to protect the walls. It targets the deep muscles of the core, including both the obliques and the transversus abdominus. It can be done fast or slow, for time or reps, either in traditional muscle-focused rep ranges such as 8-12 reps per side.

Title: Parallel bars leg raise
Desc: The parallel bars leg raise is a bodyweight exercise that targets the abs. It is performed on parallel bars, starting in the top position of a dip. Leg raises are often performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps or more, as part of ab-focused training. However, this difficult variation may require some time to build up to those rep ranges.

Title: Otis-up-
Desc: The Otis-up is a weighted exercise focusing on the abdominal muscles and the shoulders to a lesser degree. It primarily targets the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles, but also involves the obliques and deep core muscles. It is normally performed on a decline bench holding a weight plate, but can also be performed with a dumbbell, kettlebell, or other weight.

Title: 30 Shoulder Tap
Desc: The shoulder tap is an exercise targeting the abdominals and core. The basic stance matches the top of a push-up position. From there, one hand is raised to tap its opposing shoulder. A tap with each hand to each opposing shoulder equals one rep.

Title: 30 Spider Crawl
Desc: The spider crawl is a bodyweight exercise that involves crawling on the floor with the knees outside of the elbows. It is different from a leopard crawl in that the hips are higher, and it's different from a bear crawl because the knees are wider. It can be done as a full-body warm-up, in short bursts for power or circuit training, or for longer durations as cardiovascular conditioning.

Title: Spider crunch
Desc: The spider crunch is a core exercise that begins in a straight-arm plank position and involves raising one knee toward your same-side elbow to target the obliques. It is similar to a mountain climber, but with the knees out wider. It can be performed for time or reps as bodyweight ab training or conditioning.

Title: Toe-touch
Desc: The toe-touch is a bodyweight movement that targets the muscles of the abs, the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles in particular. It can be performed for time or reps in the ab-focused portion of any workout.

Title: 30 Hanging Toes-To-Bar
Desc: The hanging toes-to-bar is an advanced abdominal exercise in which the lifter touches their feet to a pull-up bar. There are many ways to perform this movement: strict or swinging, arms completely straight or slightly bent, legs straight or bent, each providing unique benefits and challenges. Initially, it may be a difficult move to do for a single rep, but once you build the requisite core, lat, and shoulder strength, it can be performed for higher reps.

Title: 30 V-Up
Desc: The V-up is a bodyweight movement that targets the muscles of the abs, the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles in particular. It is similar to a suitcase crunch, but the lower back lifts off the ground at the top of each rep. It can be performed for time or reps in the ab-focused portion of any workout.

Title: Cocoon crunch
Desc: The cocoon crunch is a bodyweight exercise targeting the ab muscles, the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles in particular. It involves bringing your knees to your chest and your arms from overhead to center. It can be performed for time or reps as part of the ab-focused portion of any workout.

Title: Bench oblique crunch
Desc: The bench oblique crunch is an exercise that targets the obliques, the muscles running alongside the rectus abdominis. The range of motion is fairly small, but it still does a great job of working these hard-to-isolate muscles. Like most crunch variations, it is usually performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more.

Title: Full moon-
Desc: The full moon is a bodyweight exercise targeting the muscles of the abs. It is similar to a V-up, but with the added challenge of “drawing” a circle shape in the air during each rep. It can be performed for time or reps in the core-focused portion of any workout.

Title: Push-up to side plank
Desc: The push-up to side plank is an upper-body and core-focused exercise combining two popular bodyweight movements. It targets the chest, triceps, and shoulders with the push-up, and the obliques and hip external rotator muscles with the side plank. It can be performed as part of a dynamic warm-up or any bodyweight strength-training workout.

Title: Tyler Holt V-Up
Desc: "Hold a plank position, engage abdominals, and lift legs off ground while keeping body straight. Alternate bringing knees towards chest for added challenge."

Title: Tyler Holt Plank
Desc: "Hold a steady position with hands shoulder-width apart, engaging abs to support body weight, maintaining a straight line from head to heels for a challenging abdominal workout."

Title: Tyler Holt Hip-Dip
Desc: "Engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine, then rapidly dip your hips as low as possible while maintaining control and returning to start."

Title: Suicides
Desc: "Start in a plank position, engage core and bring one knee up towards chest, quickly switch to other leg. Repeat, alternating legs for 30 seconds."

Title: Holman Towel Straight Plank Jack
Desc: "Hold a plank position, then jump feet between hands while keeping core engaged and lower back straight. Quickly return to plank."

Title: Holman Towel Hill Climber
Desc: "Hold towel taut between hands, engage core, and explosively lift feet off floor, holding for a brief moment before controlled descent."

Title: Holman Towel Elbow Plank Jack
Desc: "Hold a plank position with arms and legs straight, then quickly jack your feet to one side while keeping core engaged, and return to the starting position. Repeat."

Title: Holman Towel Elbow Plank Pike
Desc: Hold a plank position, engage abdominals, and lift right elbow towards shoulders while keeping left arm straight, then switch sides.

Title: Holman Towel Straight Plank Hand Reach
Desc: "Start in a plank position, engage core and hold straight. Slowly reach for towel held by partner, stretching abs and maintaining form."

Title: Holman Towel Wax-On Wax-Off
Desc: "Hold a towel between your knees, engage core and lift legs off ground. Alternate legs in a figure-eight pattern, keeping core tight and abs contracting."

Title: Holman Towel Wide Hill Climber
Desc: Hold a towel wide stance, engage core, and slowly climb into plank position, keeping abs tight. Lower and repeat for control.

Title: Holman Towel Dirty Dog
Desc: "Hold a dirty dog position, engaging abdominals to maintain plank shape. Slowly lower and raise torso, targeting obliques and abs."

Title: Holman Straight Plank Shoulder Tap
Desc: "Start in a plank position, engage abdominals. Lift opposite arm and tap shoulder. Quickly switch arms, maintaining straight body and core control."

Title: Holman Killer Abs
Desc: "Hold a plank position, engage core, and lift legs off ground. Alternate bringing knees to chest while maintaining straight back and shoulders."

Title: Holman Straight Plank Split Jack
Desc: "Start in a plank position, then jump feet apart to split stance. Lower body towards ground, engaging abs and keeping core tight. Quickly return to plank."

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Swim
Desc: Hold a plank position while simultaneously swimming your arms, engaging your core and maintaining a straight line from head to heels.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Saw
Desc: Hold a plank position, engage abs, and slowly draw knees towards chest while keeping back straight.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Straight Plank Toe-Tap Series
Desc: "Hold a plank position with feet elevated, engage core and alternate tapping toes to ground, maintaining straight line from head to heels."

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Pike Pull
Desc: From a plank position, engage core and lift right leg off ground, keeping knee bent. Slowly pull right leg towards chest, then return to starting position. Repeat on other side.

Title: Holman Hand-Elevated Walk-Over Push-Up
Desc: "Start in a plank position, elevate hands off ground, and slowly walk feet forward while keeping core engaged to target abdominals."

Title: Holman Hands-Elevated Hill Climber
Desc: "Hold a plank position, elevate hands and feet off the ground. Engage abs to lift upper body towards legs, then slowly lower back down."

Title: Holman Seated Pike
Desc: "Hold a seated position, engage core and lift legs straight up, keeping knees bent. Lower slowly, then return to start."

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Up-Down Plank
Desc: "Start in a plank position with feet elevated, engage core and slowly lower body until head nearly touches floor. Pause, then return to starting position."

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Hand Tap
Desc: "Lift legs feet-elevated, engage abdominals to stabilize. Quickly tap hands on ground, focus on core activation and controlled movement."

Title: Holman Reverse Straight Plank with Alternating Heel Pull-In
Desc: From a reverse plank position, pull one heel towards glutes while maintaining straight line from head to heels, alternating legs and engaging core muscles.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank
Desc: "Hold a plank position with forearms parallel to ground, elbows bent at 90 degrees, and engage core. Maintain straight line from head to heels for desired duration."

Title: Holman Straight Plank Squat Thrust
Desc: "Hold a plank position, then squat and swing your arms to lift torso into straight line from head to heels, engaging abdominals."

Title: Holman Alternating Single-Leg Pike
Desc: "Hold a plank position, lift one leg off the ground and balance on the other. Alternate legs, keeping core engaged to target abdominals."

Title: Holman Knee Pull-In Crunch
Desc: "Lie on your back, knees bent and feet flat. Engage core and pull right knee towards chest while rotating torso. Return to starting position and repeat with left side."

Title: Holman Straight Plank with Hand Tap
Desc: "Start in a plank position, engage abs and maintain straight line from head to heels. Slowly tap each hand on ground, alternating hands, for added core challenge."

Title: Holman Straight Plank with Dirty Dog
Desc: "Start in a plank position, engage core and maintain straight line from head to heels. Hold for 30 seconds to 1 minute, targeting abdominal strength."

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Roll
Desc: Hold a plank position, engage core and slowly roll onto one elbow, keeping body straight, then return to starting position. Repeat on opposite side.

Title: Holman Froggy Push-Up
Desc: "Hold a frog-like position, engage abdominals and slowly lower body until chest nearly touches ground. Pause, then push back up to starting position."

Title: Holman Straight Plank Hand Tap to Shoulder Tap
Desc: Hold a straight plank, engage core and lift right arm towards shoulder. Tap hand to shoulder, then lower and repeat with left arm.

Title: Holman In-Out Straight Plank
Desc: Hold a plank position, engage core, and alternate bringing each elbow towards opposite knee while maintaining straight body.

Title: Holman Bicycle
Desc: "Hold a straight body position, alternate bringing each elbow to the opposite knee while keeping core muscles engaged, using abdominal strength to maintain control."

Title: Holman Alternating Diagonal Knee Pull-in
Desc: "Hold plank position, alternate bringing right knee towards left elbow and then left knee to right elbow, engaging abdominal muscles for core stability."

Title: Holman Elbow Plank with Step-Out
Desc: Hold a plank position, engage abs and step one foot forward, keeping body straight. Switch sides, holding for 30-60 seconds.

Title: Holman Alternating Slow L-Raise
Desc: "Hold a plank position, alternate lifting your knees towards your chest while keeping your core engaged and slowly lowering back down."

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Plank with Shoulder Tap
Desc: Start in a plank position with feet elevated, engage core, and lift right shoulder towards left elbow; repeat on the other side.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Inchworm Pike to Straight Plank Push-Up
Desc: From a feet-elevated inchworm position, engage abs and walk hands forward into a pike stance. Lower body towards ground, then push back up to straight plank pose.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Up-Down Elbow Plank
Desc: "Hold a feet-elevated plank position, engaging abdominals. Slowly lower body towards the ground, then push back up to starting position, maintaining core control throughout."

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Plank Pike Pull
Desc: "Hold a feet-elevated plank position, engage core, and slowly draw right knee towards chest while keeping left leg straight. Alternate legs."

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Alternating Single-Leg Hip Raise
Desc: "Hold feet elevated, lift and lower one leg while keeping core engaged to target abdominals; alternate legs for added challenge."

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Plank Pike Pull to Push-Up
Desc: Hold a plank position with feet elevated, engage core, then lift top foot towards glutes while pulling opposite heel back. Slowly return to start, transitioning into a push-up.

Title: Holman Standing Heel Click
Desc: "Engage core, stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart. Slowly lift one heel off the ground, keeping knee straight, then click it back down to return to start."

Title: Holman Straight Plank Right-Left Jack to Split Jack
Desc: "Hold a straight plank position, then explosively jack from side to side, shifting into split jacks before returning to the starting position."

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Jack to Ninja Knees
Desc: "Hold a plank position with elbows bent, then jack knees apart while maintaining abs' engagement. Quickly return to start, repeating fluidly."

Title: Holman Right Side Elbow Plank with Left Leg Swing
Desc: "Start in a right side elbow plank, engage abdominals. Lift left leg off ground, swing it back and forth while maintaining plank form."

Title: Holman Left Side Elbow Plank with Right Leg Swing
Desc: Holding a left side elbow plank, engage abdominals and lift right leg off ground, swinging it forward and backward in controlled motion.

Title: Holman Straight Plank with Alternating Diagonal Sit-Back
Desc: From a plank position, engage abs and alternate bringing each elbow to opposite knee, slowly sitting back while keeping core tight.

Title: Holman Boat Press with Leg Extension
Desc: "Hold a boat pose, extending one leg straight out. Engage abdominals to maintain position and alternate legs for added challenge."

Title: Holman Shoulder Tap to Dirty Dog
Desc: Lie on your back, engage core. Tap shoulders off floor, lift legs toward ceiling, and tap heels together. Quickly return to starting position.

Title: Holman Standing Russian Twist
Desc: Hold a plank position, twist torso to left and right, keeping core engaged, targeting obliques.

Title: Holman Hovering Plank with Shoulder Tap
Desc: "Hold a plank position, engage abdominals, and lift left shoulder off ground. Tap shoulder to opposite side without letting it touch the floor. Repeat on other side."

Title: Holman Elbow Plank to Stacked Plank Hip Drop
Desc: Hold a plank position, engage abs, and simultaneously drop hips down towards the ground, maintaining control and stability throughout.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank to Walk-Up Pike
Desc: From a plank position, engage abs and walk hands forward into a pike position, keeping core tight, then slowly return to the starting position.

Title: Holman Hill Climber
Desc: "Hold a plank position with hands shoulder-width apart, then alternate bringing each knee towards chest, engaging abdominal muscles to climb 'hill'."

Title: Holman Straight Plank Pike to Renegade Row
Desc: "Hold a plank position, then quickly shift into a pike pose and row the opposite arm towards your knee, alternating sides while engaging core muscles."

Title: Holman Alternating Hip Drop to Push-Up
Desc: "Hold a plank position, alternate dropping hips, then lower into a push-up. Quickly return to plank, targeting core and abdominal muscles."

Title: Holman Crab Kick
Desc: Lie on back, engage core, lift legs towards ceiling, then swiftly kick one leg forward, keeping other straight, alternating sides for a strong abdominal workout.

Title: Holman Wounded Bear Crawl
Desc: Start in a plank position, engage core and bear crawl forward, keeping shoulders down, hips lifted and alternating arms. Focus on slow, controlled movements.

Title: Holman Alternating Crab Reach
Desc: "Hold a plank position, alternate bringing each arm towards opposite knee, keeping abs engaged and core stable."

Title: Holman Hovering Panther Core Stabilizer
Desc: "Hold a hover position, engage core, and slowly lift legs and arms in unison, keeping body straight and stable; maintain for 30 seconds."

Title: Holman Burpee to Forward Lunge
Desc: "Start in a squat position, jump forward into a lunge while keeping core engaged and holding for a brief moment before returning to the starting position, effectively engaging abdominals."

Title: Holman Seated Knee Pull-In Series
Desc: Engage core and slowly pull knees towards chest, squeezing abdominals; maintain position for brief moment before releasing.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Pike
Desc: "Hold a plank position, engage abs, then lift legs and torso into a pike. Balance on elbows and hold for a challenging abdominal exercise."

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Jack to Straight Plank Split Jack
Desc: Hold a plank position, then rapidly alternate bringing knees up towards chest while keeping abs engaged. Quickly transition into a straight plank and repeat the alternating leg movement.

Title: Holman Boat Pull-Over
Desc: "Hold a plank position, engage core and slowly pull torso forward, lifting head and shoulders off ground, squeezing abs at peak."

Title: Holman Squat Pulse to Plyometric Jump
Desc: "Engage core, drop into a squat, and explosively pulse up to jump, targeting abdominals with quick, powerful movements."

Title: Holman Hands Down Heel Click
Desc: "Hold a hands-down position on all fours, engage core, and lift heels off ground. Slowly click heels towards glutes, squeezing abdominals."

Title: Holman Straight Plank to Kick-Up
Desc: "Hold a straight plank, engage core, then lift legs and hold for a brief moment before slowly lowering back down. Focus on controlled movements."

Title: Holman Hands-Elevated Split Jack
Desc: "Start in a plank position, hands elevated on blocks or books. Engage core and explosively jump feet apart into a split stance, keeping hands and upper body stable."

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Plank Reach
Desc: "Hold a feet-elevated plank position, engage abdominals. Slowly reach forward, extending arm and keeping core stable, then return to start."

Title: Holman Hand-Elevated Side Plank Semicircle
Desc: Hold a side plank position, elevate your hand to form an arch, and slowly slide into a semicircle shape, engaging abdominals for 30 seconds.

Title: Holman Hands-Elevated Straight Plank Pike
Desc: "Hold a hands-elevated straight plank position, engage core and slowly lift legs towards ceiling, keeping body in a straight line from head to heels."

Title: Holman Alternating Rolling Elbow Plank
Desc: "Hold a plank position, engage core, and lift one elbow towards opposite shoulder while rotating torso. Alternate sides for dynamic abdominal strength."

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Jack
Desc: "Hold a plank position while simultaneously lifting right arm and left leg off the ground, then quickly switch sides. Focus on core engagement."

Title: Holman Squat Thrust to Alternating Knee-In
Desc: "Start in a squat position, then explosively thrust body upward and bring one knee towards chest while maintaining abdominal contraction. Alternate legs quickly, focusing on core engagement."

Title: Holman Supine Double Pike
Desc: Lie supine, arms extended overhead and legs straight. Engage abdominals to lift torso and legs into a double pike position, then slowly lower back down. Repeat for control and strength.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Alternating Pike
Desc: Start in an elbow plank position, then alternate bringing each foot towards your hands while maintaining a straight line from head to heels. Hold for 1-2 seconds before returning to the starting position.

Title: Holman Seated Killer Abs
Desc: Engage your core and sit upright, hands behind you, then slowly lift torso towards knees while keeping abs tight, pause, and return to start position.

Title: Holman Side Plank Hip Drop
Desc: Hold a side plank position, engaging your core. Slowly drop your hips down towards the ground, keeping your body straight, then lift back up to the starting position.

Title: Holman Wide Hill Climber
Desc: Holding a wide, bent leg position, engage abdominals to lift opposite leg towards hip, squeezing at top before slowly lowering.

Title: Holman Straight-Legged Bicycle
Desc: "Engage core and lift straight legs off ground, alternating cycling motion with arms, keeping back straight and abs tight."

Title: Holman Stair Toe Tap
Desc: From a plank position, engage core and lift one leg off the ground, tapping toes on floor before switching to the other side.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Ninja
Desc: Hold a plank position, engage core, and lift one elbow towards opposite shoulder, keeping body straight; hold for 1-2 seconds before returning to start.

Title: Holman Traveling Stair Climb Push-Up
Desc: "Start in a plank position, engage core, and slowly lift upper body towards stairs as you travel up, maintaining control throughout the movement."

Title: Holman Hands-Elevated Burpee
Desc: "Start in a plank position, then swiftly drop into a squat and kick back into a handstand. Quickly return to standing, keeping hands elevated."

Title: Holman Straight Plank Donkey Kick
Desc: "Hold a straight plank position, engage core and lift right leg towards ceiling, keeping knee bent. Alternate sides."

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Straight Plank Pike Pull
Desc: "Engage abs, lift feet off ground and place heels on elevated surface. Draw belly button towards spine, extending legs straight up."

Title: Holman Towel Burpee
Desc: "Start in a plank position, then drop into a squat and kick back into a plank. Quickly lift your knees to your chest and hold for a moment before standing up."

Title: Holman Elbow Plank to Alternating Side Plank Crunch
Desc: Start in elbow plank, engage core, then alternate sides by bringing one hand to shoulder and crunching up while rotating torso.

Title: Holman Straight-Legged Hip Raise
Desc: Lying on your back, engage core and lift straight legs to ceiling, squeezing abs at top before slowly lowering.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Hill Climber
Desc: "Hold feet elevated on a surface, engage core, and slowly lift knees towards chest, squeezing abdominals, then lower back down."

Title: Holman Ninja Knee Hill Climber
Desc: Start in a plank position, engage core and explosively drive knees up towards chest, drawing belly button to spine. Repeat quickly, alternating legs.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Shoulder Tap
Desc: "Starting on all fours, lift feet off ground and engage core. Slowly tap shoulders to opposite sides, keeping body straight and controlled."

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Hip Raise
Desc: Lying on your back, elevate your feet and engage your core. Lift your hips, squeezing your abdominals, then slowly lower and repeat.

Title: Holman Left Hand Right Foot Crab Reach
Desc: "Start in a plank position, engage core and quickly shift weight to left hand while lifting right foot off ground, reaching for distant object with right hand."

Title: Holman Alternating Crab Flip to Froggy Push-Up to Kicks
Desc: "From a plank position, alternate bringing knees towards chest while flipping arms up. Quickly transition into a push-up, then kick one leg forward as the other returns to starting position."

Title: Holman Right Hand Left Foot Sleeping Crab
Desc: "Lie on your back, engage core. Lift right hand and left foot off ground, holding sleeping crab position. Hold for a moment, then slowly lower."

Title: Holman Left Hand Right Foot Sleeping Crab
Desc: "Hold a straight body position, engage core, and lift left hand off ground while lifting right foot off floor. Alternate legs and hands in slow motion."

Title: Holman Straight Plank with Alternating Leg Kick-Under
Desc: "Hold a straight plank position, then lift one leg towards the opposite hand and quickly 'kick-under' to meet it. Alternate legs."

Title: Holman Right Hip Drop Push-Up
Desc: "Start in a plank position, then drop your right hip down towards the ground while keeping your upper body stable and engage your abdominal muscles to lift your hips back up."

Title: Holman Right Side Diagonal Burpee
Desc: "Start in a plank position, quickly drop into a squat and kick your right foot forward. Stand up, rotate torso to left, and jump forward as you raise arms overhead; repeat on the other side."

Title: Holman Left Hip Drop Push-Up
Desc: Lower your body until your left hip almost touches the ground, engaging abs to maintain a straight line from head to heels.

Title: Holman Right Leg 7-Up Crunch
Desc: "Hold a straight line with your legs, lift right leg towards ceiling, crunching abs. Pause, then lower slowly."

Title: Holman Left Leg 7-Up Crunch
Desc: Lift left leg straight up, keeping knee slightly bent. Engage abdominals to support and lift torso off ground, holding for a brief moment before slowly lowering back down.

Title: Holman Straight Plank Jack
Desc: "Hold a plank position, then explosively jump feet apart and back together, engaging core muscles to maintain stability."

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Couch Hill Climber
Desc: "Start in a plank position with feet elevated on a couch. Engage core, lift one leg towards ceiling, then quickly switch legs, mimicking the motion of running up stairs."

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Right Side Plank
Desc: Lying on your left side, elevate right foot and engage core to support body weight. Hold a challenging plank position, maintaining abdominal contraction.

Title: Holman Alternating Up-Down Plank to Push-Up
Desc: From a plank position, alternate bringing each elbow towards the opposite knee while maintaining straight body and engage abs. Lower into a push-up, then repeat in reverse order.

Title: Holman Straight Plank Pike
Desc: "Hold a plank position, engage core and slowly lift right leg straight up towards ceiling, keeping abs tight. Lower and repeat with opposite leg."

Title: Holman Ninja Knee Straight Plank
Desc: Hold a plank position, engage core and lift left knee towards chest while keeping right leg straight, pause, then switch sides.

Title: Holman Reverse Crunch to Hip Raise
Desc: Lying on your back, engage core and lift hips towards ceiling while maintaining straight line from head to heels, then raise hips higher without arching lower back.

Title: Holman Straight Plank Quick Reach
Desc: "Hold a plank position, engage core and quickly reach one hand forward, then return to start. Alternate sides for added challenge."

Title: Holman Alternating Diagonal Straight Plank
Desc: Hold a plank position, engage core, and alternate bringing each elbow to opposite knee while maintaining straight line from head to heels.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Left Side Plank
Desc: "Hold a plank position with feet elevated on the left side, engage core muscles and maintain stability to effectively train the abdominals."

Title: Holman Right Hand Left Foot Crab Reach
Desc: "Start in a plank position, lift right hand and left foot off ground. Reach for toes with right hand while straightening left leg, engaging abdominal muscles to maintain control."

Title: Holman Low-Impact Crab Kick
Desc: "Hold a plank position, engage core and lift right leg off floor. Quickly alternate kicking legs as if swimming, targeting abs and keeping body stable."

Title: Holman Alternating Crab Flip to Froggy Push-Up
Desc: "Start in a plank position, alternate bringing each elbow towards opposite knee. Quickly flip into a frog push-up, engaging abs throughout. Reverse the motion and repeat."

Title: Holman High-Impact Crab Kick
Desc: Start in a plank position, engage core and lift right leg into a 45-degree angle. Quickly switch to left leg, using abs for stability and power.

Title: Holman Single-Leg Right Pike
Desc: "Hold a single-leg stance on your right foot, keeping your left leg straight. Lower into a pike position, engaging your core and maintaining balance."

Title: Holman Single-Leg Left Pike
Desc: Engage your core and lift left leg straight up, balancing on right foot. Slowly lower into a pike position, keeping back straight, then return to standing.

Title: Holman Shoulder Tap to Hand Tap
Desc: "Engage abdominals, simultaneously lift opposite arm and tap shoulder while bringing contralateral hand to meet it. Alternate sides."

Title: Holman Towel Reverse Plank Jack
Desc: "Hold a reverse plank, engaging abs and maintaining core stability. Jump feet apart while keeping back straight, then quickly return to starting position."

Title: Holman Side-to-Side Twist
Desc: "Hold a side plank position, twist torso sideways, keeping abs engaged. Switch sides, maintaining control and core stability."

Title: Holman Crab Kick with Hop
Desc: "Holman Crab Kick with Hop: Lying on back, hands behind head, alternate lifting shoulders and performing a rapid kick, then quickly hopping feet off the ground."

Title: Holman Crab Reach to Crab Kick
Desc: "Hold a crab position, then reach forward with one hand while kicking back with the opposite leg, engaging abdominals and transferring weight."

Title: Holman Wide Squat Side-to-Side Obliques
Desc: "Stand with feet wide apart, then perform a squat while rotating your torso and engaging obliques. Alternate sides, keeping core stable."

Title: Holman Side Plank Crunch
Desc: Hold a side plank position, engage core, and lift top knee towards shoulder while keeping legs straight.

Title: Total Fitness Ab Tuck
Desc: The hollow-body knee tuck is a bodyweight abdominal exercise performed on the floor. It is similar to both the hollow-body hold and the knee tuck or reverse crunch, combining elements of both. It primarily targets the muscles of the rectus abdominis, or “six-pack” muscles. It can be performed for reps or time, either as part of an ab-focused workout or as a component of a circuit workout.

Title: Active hang from bar
Desc: The active hang from bar is a static exercise that involves isometrically squeezing the shoulders into the sockets and activating the muscles of the upper back and core. It can be used to improve pull-up form or to do more pull-ups, but also has postural and shoulder health benefits.

Title: Cat-cow
Desc: Cat-cow is a traditional yoga pose that is also popular in fitness and strength training. It targets spinal mobility and control of the vertebral column. It can be performed for time or reps as part of a dynamic warm-up or as a mobility or restorative exercise anytime. It can also work as part of a yoga or bodyweight sequence with other poses.

Title: Crab walk
Desc: The crab walk is a full-body exercise that has been popular in schools and gym classes for decades. It's a full-body coordination challenge that also burns serious calories, making it an excellent inclusion in a full-body warm-up or bodyweight circuit workout.

Title: Lunge with overhead reach
Desc: The lunge with overhead reach is a full-body bodyweight movement targeting the quads and shoulders. It has both strength and mobility benefits and can be performed one leg at a time or alternating for time or for reps.

Title: Hang from bar
Desc: The hang from bar is a static exercise that involves hanging from a bar by two hands. It can either be an "active hang," where you pack the shoulders and activate the muscles of the upper back, or a "passive hang," where you let the shoulders unpack and let the muscles of the upper body stretch. A passive hang may not be appropriate for all people depending on their shoulder health, but many coaches believe hanging can be healthy for the shoulders when done properly.

Title: Total Fitness Hollow Hold
Desc: The hollow-body hold is an isometric exercise that increases strength and stability in the core muscles. It is common in gymnastics training, CrossFit training, and as a core tension and bracing drill for lifters and athletes of all types. It is performed for time and can be performed as an activation drill prior to lifting, as part of a circuit, or as equipment-free core training anytime.

Title: Total Fitness Side Plank
Desc: The side plank is a popular isometric abdominal exercise focusing on the oblique muscles, as well as the transversus abdominis or deep core muscles. It is sometimes paired with the curl up and bird dog as the “McGill big three” for core strength and stability. It is performed for time and can work in a warm-up or in the core-focused portion of any workout.

Title: Side plank pulse
Desc: The side plank pulse is a dynamic version of the side plank exercise focusing on the oblique muscles, as well as the transversus abdominis or deep core muscles. It can be performed for time or reps and can work in a warm-up or in the core-focused portion of any workout.

Title: Total Fitness Spider Crawl (Unweighted)
Desc: The spider crawl is a bodyweight exercise that involves crawling on the floor with the knees outside of the elbows. It is different from a leopard crawl in that the hips are higher, and it's different from a bear crawl because the knees are wider. It can be done as a full-body warm-up, in short bursts for power or circuit training, or for longer durations as cardiovascular conditioning.

Title: Total Fitness V-Up
Desc: The V-up is a bodyweight movement that targets the muscles of the abs, the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles in particular. It is similar to a suitcase crunch, but the lower back lifts off the ground at the top of each rep. It can be performed for time or reps in the ab-focused portion of any workout.

Title: MetaBurn Alternating Knee-to-Elbow Mountain Climber
Desc: "Engage core, lift right knee towards left elbow while keeping legs straight. Alternate sides quickly, mimicking mountain climbing motion."

Title: Alternating sit-through with crunch-
Desc: The alternating sit-through with crunch is a full-body movement that starts in a bear crawl position and ends with a leg kicked out to the side. In between reps, you perform a crunch. It is commonly performed for reps or time in bodyweight circuits and animal-style flows, but can also work on its own or as part of a dynamic warm-up or mobility sequence.

Title: MetaBurn Alternating Toe-Touch
Desc: "From plank position, alternate touching toes to ground while engaging core and keeping body straight. Focus on slow, controlled movements."

Title: MetaBurn Janda Sit-Up
Desc: "Hold a Janda-style sit-up position, engage core, and slowly lift upper body off ground, keeping shoulders down. Lower back to start with control."

Title: MetaBurn Oblique Roll Crunch
Desc: Lying on your back, lift shoulders off ground and bring elbow to opposite knee. Rotate torso, crunching abs while drawing opposite elbow towards same knee. Repeat, alternating sides.

Title: MetaBurn Plank Jack
Desc: "Start in a plank position, engage core and jump feet between hands, landing softly on toes. Quickly repeat for a dynamic abdominal workout."

Title: MetaBurn Plank To Alternating Side Plank
Desc: "Hold a plank, then transfer weight to one side, engaging abdominal muscles; alternate sides for added challenge."

Title: MetaBurn Plank Up-Down
Desc: "Start in a plank position, engage core, then lift right arm and left leg off ground, hold briefly, and quickly return to starting position. Alternate sides."

Title: MetaBurn Plank Wiper
Desc: "Hold a plank position, then lift right leg off ground and draw small circles as if wiping floor. Alternate legs, engaging core for added stability."

Title: MetaBurn Plank With Alternating Toe-Touch
Desc: "Hold a plank position, engaging abs. Alternate touching toes by lifting left leg and lowering right, then switching. Focus on controlled movements and core engagement."

Title: MetaBurn Plyo Push-Up
Desc: Start in a plank position, engage core and explosively push up to hands, quickly return to initial position, repeating rapid movements to target abdominals.

Title: MetaBurn Psycho Crunch
Desc: Start in a plank position, engage core, and lift right leg towards chest while simultaneously crunching torso upwards. Hold momentarily before lowering and repeating on opposite side.

Title: MetaBurn Scapular Retraction Plank
Desc: "Hold a plank position, drawing shoulder blades together and squeezing abdominals. Maintain for 30-60 seconds, engaging core and stabilizing body."

Title: MetaBurn Scapular Retraction Plank Hold
Desc: "Hold a plank position, engage abdominals and retract scapula by squeezing shoulder blades together. Maintain for duration, keeping core muscles activated."

Title: MetaBurn Scorpion
Desc: "Engage core, lift legs off floor and flex feet towards glutes. Twist torso, bringing shoulders towards knees, then quickly return to start."

Title: MetaBurn Side Crawler
Desc: "Start in a plank position, engage core, and slowly crawl sideways with hands dragging along floor, targeting obliques."

Title: MetaBurn Side Plank Oblique Crunch
Desc: "Engage core, lift legs and hips off ground, crunch obliques by bringing knees towards shoulders. Hold for time, focus on slow and controlled movements."

Title: MetaBurn Sit-Through
Desc: "Hold a sit-through position, engaging abs to support body weight. Slowly lower torso towards the ground while keeping back straight, then lift back up to starting position."

Title: MetaBurn Sit-Up To V-Up
Desc: "Hold a meta position, then engage core and lift torso from sit-up to v-up. Lower back to start, squeezing abdominals throughout."

Title: MetaBurn Sit-Up With Rotation
Desc: "Engage core, sit up straight and lift shoulders off ground. Twist torso to left, placing right hand behind head. Slowly rotate to right side, maintaining control."

Title: MetaBurn Split-Leg Crunch
Desc: "Lie on back, engage core, lift legs in opposite directions, targeting obliques. Lower slowly, then lift and crunch forward to meet the shoulders."

Title: MetaBurn Tabletop Hip Thrust
Desc: "Engage core, lift hips towards ceiling, squeezing abdominals as you pause at the top. Slowly lower back down, keeping control throughout."

Title: MetaBurn Tabletop With Russian Kick
Desc: "Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, engage core. Lift legs into tabletop position, then extend one leg out in a Russian kick motion, focusing on control and stability."

Title: MetaBurn Toe Driver Abs
Desc: "Engage core, lift legs towards hips while keeping feet flexed. Pause, then slowly lower and repeat. Focus on controlled movement to target abdominal muscles."

Title: MetaBurn-V-Up
Desc: "Hold a plank position, then lift left leg towards ceiling, twisting torso to meet. Quickly switch sides, alternating 6-8 times."

Title: X-body V-up
Desc: The X-body V-up is a bodyweight abdominal exercise performed on the floor. It is similar to the popular V-up exercise, but is performed with the arms and legs out wide in an X-shape. It primarily targets the muscles of the rectus abdominis, or “six-pack” muscles. It can be performed for reps or time, either as part of an ab-focused workout or as a component of a circuit workout.

Title: MetaBurn Swivel Crunch
Desc: "Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat. Engage core, lift shoulders off ground, and twist torso to left while bringing right elbow to knee. Alternate sides."

Title: Robertson Core-Engaged Dead Bug
Desc: "Lie on your back, arms extended overhead and legs lifted off the ground. Engage core, then slowly lower legs towards floor without letting them touch, maintaining a straight line from head to heels."

Title: FYR2 Double-Under
Desc: "Engage core, lift knees towards chest while keeping feet together, and quickly switch between sit-ups and leg raises to challenge abdominal strength."

Title: FYR2 Fire Feet with Burpee Tuck Jump Drill
Desc: "Start in a plank position, engage core and jump feet to hands, immediately tucking knees up towards chest before landing softly on hands. Repeat for added abdominal strength."

Title: FYR2 Flutter Kick
Desc: Lying on your back, engage core and lift legs towards ceiling. Quickly flutter kick legs, keeping them straight, to target abdominals. Focus on rapid contractions and releases for a strong and controlled movement.

Title: FYR2 Half-Moon
Desc: "Hold a half-moon shape by engaging your core, keeping legs and arms straight. Lower your body, stretching abs, then lift back up to starting position."

Title: FYR2 Leopard Crawl
Desc: Start in a plank position, engage core and slowly drag feet away from hands, keeping body straight, then quickly return to start. Repeat for a challenging abdominal workout.

Title: FYR2 Plank Alternating Front Step
Desc: Hold a plank position, alternating bringing one foot forward while keeping core muscles engaged to target abdominals.

Title: FYR2 Shoulder Tap
Desc: "Engage core and quickly alternate tapping your shoulders with your hands, maintaining a steady pace to target abdominals effectively."

Title: Hand shift plank
Desc: The hand shift plank is a progression of the straight-arm plank exercise where you maintain a plank position as you shift your hands side to side. The additional movement forces the core muscles to work harder to stabilize.

Title: Cross-body plank march
Desc: The cross-body plank march is an exercise targeting the entire core but especially the obliques. It’s more difficult than a standard plank, with the extra stabilization challenge of bringing one knee at a time off the ground toward the opposing elbow. This will increase the challenge to the core and shoulder muscles, but also present a coordination and balance challenge.

Title: Bent-knee Copenhagen hip adduction
Desc: The bent-knee Copenhagen hip adduction is an advanced exercise that combines the isometric stabilization of the Copenhagen plank with dynamic adductions to challenge the core stabilizers and adductors. This exercise targets the same muscles as the side plank, including the obliques, shoulders, and lateral hips, but places extra emphasis on the adductors and is more difficult than side planks on the floor. Most lifters will need to progress to this version after mastering the basic side plank or Copenhagen plank first.

Title: Copenhagen plank
Desc: The Copenhagen plank is an advanced version of the side plank performed with one foot on a bench and the other foot hovering under it. This exercise targets the same muscles as the side plank, including the obliques, shoulders, and lateral hips, but places extra emphasis on the adductors and is more difficult than side planks on the floor. Most lifters will need to progress to this version after mastering the basic side plank or feet-elevated side plank first.

Title: ACFT Hanging leg tuck
Desc: The hanging leg tuck is an exercise targeting the entire body, including the arms, upper back, abs, and hip flexors. This specific exercise is part of the new Army Combat Fitness Test or ACFT. It is performe while hanging from a bar and combines elements of a pull-up with a leg raise. Experienced lifters make these look easy, but beginners may need time to build up to sets of 8-12 reps.

Title: Alternating hanging knee raise
Desc: The alternating hanging knee raise is an exercise targeting the abs, but which also works the lats and hip flexors. Rather than performing both legs at a time, you lift one knee at a time and alternate with each rep as if marching in place. Knee raises are often performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps or more, as part of ab-focused training.

Title: Plank To Sphinx
Desc: "Hold a plank position, then slowly lower your body to a sphinx pose by tucking chin and drawing knees towards chest, engaging abdominals throughout the movement."

Title: Twisting Mountain Climbers
Desc: "Start in a plank position, engage core, and bring one knee up towards chest while twisting torso. Alternate legs, keeping abs tight."

Title: Jack Knives
Desc: "Start in a plank position, engage core and lower body until chest almost touches ground, then explosively return to top. Repeat quickly for optimal strength and control."

Title: Hanging Leg Raises
Desc: "Hang from a bar, engage core, and lift legs towards ceiling while keeping straight. Lower slowly, then repeat."

Title: Dumbbell suitcase crunch
Desc: The dumbbell suitcase crunch is a weighted version of a popular abdominal training exercise. The simple addition of a weight makes the suitcase crunch far more difficult, helping build the "six pack" muscles and providing a different stimulus to the core during training.

Title: Medicine ball rotational throw
Desc: The medicine ball rotational throw is an explosive exercise targeting the abdominals, including the obliques, as well as the hips and upper back.
