Desc: Stand on one leg, bend knee slightly, and explosively jump forward while landing softly on the same leg. Repeat.

Title: Trap Bar Jump
Desc: Explosively lift trap bar off ground, then rapidly extend knees to jump, landing softly on balls of feet and immediately repeating.

Title: Single-Leg Lateral Hop
Desc: Hop on one leg, lifting other foot off ground, and explosively jump sideways while keeping knee bent to engage quadriceps.

Title: Burpee Box-Jumps
Desc: "Drop down into a squat, kick back into a plank, jump up to box height, and explosively jump back down. Quickly repeat, focusing on powerful quadriceps activation."

Title: Sandbag Load
Desc: Load a sandbag onto your shoulders, taking care not to let it roll off. Step out with one foot and lower into a quarter squat, keeping back straight and knees behind toes. Push through heels to return to standing.

Title: Single-leg knee-tap squat
Desc: The single-leg knee-tap squat is a single-leg squat variation that involves “floating” the back leg over the ground on the descent until touching just the knee to the ground or a pad. It is similar to a lunge, but without touching the back foot to the ground. It is an intense strength and coordination challenge that can work in any strength- or athleticism-focused workout.

Title: Car Deadlift
Desc: "Hold a heavy car tire with both hands, stand over it with feet shoulder-width apart, then bend and lift the tire to hip level, engaging quadriceps."

Title: Barbell Squat To A Box
Desc: Stand over a box, grip barbell shoulders-width apart. Lower into a squat, keeping back straight and knees in line with toes, then explosively stand up, jumping onto the box.

Title: Double Under
Desc: "Jump rope under swing, quickly alternating feet to mimic a double under motion, engaging quadriceps and improving cardiovascular endurance."

Title: Plate push
Desc: The plate push is a conditioning exercise that targets the cardiovascular system and the muscles of the lower body. It involves pushing a plate along turf or another flat surface either for time or distance. It can be used as part of a dynamic warm-up or for power training, as a finisher, or as part of a conditioning workout or circuit.

Title: Hybrid deadlift
Desc: The hybrid deadlift is a version of the barbell deadlift in which the lifter's stance is wider than a conventional position, but narrower than a wide sumo deadlift. The feet are just outside the shoulders and grip placement is just inside of the legs. Many non-competitive lifters find this position to be more spine friendly and strong than either of the other traditional stances. This variation of the deadlift has all the same benefits as the others, and is capable of building serious full-body and posterior chain strength.

Title: Boss Everline Suspension Side Run
Desc: "Hang from a suspension trainer with feet shoulder-width apart, engage core, and quickly lift legs to hip level, keeping knees bent at 90 degrees."

Title: Boss Everline Lunge Sled Push
Desc: "Drive a weighted sled forward with feet shoulder-width apart, keeping knees bent at 90 degrees and pushing with quadriceps. Focus on explosive power and control."

Title: Squat Bottom Position Hold
Desc: "Engage quadriceps by lowering into a deep squat, then hold position for 20-30 seconds, keeping knees bent at 90 degrees and weight evenly distributed between heels."

Title: TRX Squat Jump
Desc: "Stand on TRX suspension straps with feet shoulder-width apart, then lower into a squat. Explode upward, jumping and extending knees to target quadriceps."

Title: Landmine squat
Desc: The landmine squat is a lower-body exercise that uses an angled barbell anchored at floor level in a landmine device. It can also be performed by sticking a barbell in the corner of a room, preferably in a towel to protect the walls. The landmine squat is similar in many ways to a goblet squat, but with slight differences due to the angle of the barbell. It can be trained in traditional muscle and strength-focused rep ranges or for higher reps.

Title: Dumbbell Bulgarian split squat
Desc: The dumbbell Bulgarian split squat is a single-leg exercise targeting the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. Overloading the movement with dumbbells usually presents less of a balance challenge than putting a barbell on the back. Dumbbell split squats are usually performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per leg, but they are also effective done with heavier weights in lower rep ranges.

Title: Holman Towel Alternating Prisoner Reverse Lunge
Desc: "Stand on a towel, holding ends in each hand. Alternate performing reverse lunges, keeping back knee almost touching ground and front quadricep contracting."

Title: Holman Weighted Burpee to Belly Touch
Desc: "Start in a squat position, weight held overhead. Drop down into a plank, kick back into a lunge, then jump up and touch belly before returning to start."

Title: Holman Weighted Burpee to Front Punch
Desc: "Start in a plank position, jump into a squat, then kick back into a plank. Quickly lift legs and punch forward with weighted arm."

Title: Holman Weighted Low Squat Punch
Desc: "Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, hold weights in both hands. Drop into a low squat while simultaneously throwing a punch forward, engaging quadriceps and generating power."

Title: Holman Weighted Hook Punch to Squat Thrust
Desc: "Unweighted, punch with your non-dominant hand while squatting down, keeping knees bent. Then, explosively thrust back up, using your dominant arm for force."

Title: Holman Towel Alternating Side Lunge Squat
Desc: "Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a towel with both hands. Alternate between side lunge squat and return to standing, keeping quadriceps engaged."

Title: Holman Weighted Burpee to Renegade Side Punch
Desc: "Stand holding a weight, then drop into a squat and kick back into a plank. Do a weighted burpee, immediately striking a renegade side punch with the same arm, targeting quadriceps."

Title: Holman Weighted Reverse Lunge to Knee-Up Overhead Press
Desc: Hold a weight overhead and stand with feet hip-width apart. Perform a reverse lunge, keeping back knee almost touching ground. Simultaneously, lift knees up towards chest, then press weight upwards while returning to standing position.

Title: Holman Lunge Jump with Overhead Press
Desc: Stand with feet hip-width apart, jump into a lunge position while pressing arms overhead, then explosively extend legs and lower arms to create power and stability for the quadriceps.

Title: Holman Weighted Burpee to Belly Touch to Standing T
Desc: "From standing, drop into a squat then jump feet apart. Quickly perform a weighted burpee and finish by touching belly with hands, before standing up."

Title: Holman Weighted Squat Jump
Desc: Stand with weighted ankles, feet shoulder-width apart. Slowly lower into a squat, keeping back straight and knees behind toes. Then, explosively jump up, landing softly on the balls of your feet to train quadriceps.

Title: Holman Weighted Plie Squat
Desc: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a weighted plate or small dumbbells between legs. Lower into a plié squat, keeping weight in heels and engaging quads to return to standing position.

Title: Holman Heels-Elevated Sissy Squat
Desc: Assume a sumo stance, knees bent 90°, and heels elevated on plates or steps. Slowly descend into a squat, keeping back straight, then return to standing, squeezing quads throughout.

Title: Holman Squat Jump to Overhead Press
Desc: "From a standing position, perform a squat jump and immediately press an overhead object (e.g. medicine ball) upwards, emphasizing quadricep activation."

Title: Holman 180 Jump to Overhead Press
Desc: "From a standing position, explosively jump and simultaneously press a medicine ball overhead, targeting quadriceps strength and power."

Title: Holman Weighted Burpee to Row
Desc: "Drop down into a squat, kick back into a plank, then perform a weighted row while keeping legs bent at 90 degrees, engaging quadriceps."

Title: Holman Weighted Burpee to 180 Jump
Desc: "Stand with weighted plate, then drop into a squat, kick back into a plank, do a jump, and quickly repeat for quadriceps challenge."

Title: Holman Weighted 180 Jump
Desc: Jump up, quickly rotating body to face opposite direction while keeping knees bent and weighted arms outstretched. Land softly on balls of feet, immediately repeating sequence.

Title: Holman Weighted Narrow-Mid-Wide Hop
Desc: "Hop sideways while alternating between narrow, mid, and wide stances, weighted by arms or a medicine ball. Focus on explosive power and quadriceps engagement."

Title: Holman Alternating Weighted Diagonal Burpee
Desc: "Hold a weighted plate in each hand, alternate sides while performing a diagonal burpee, targeting quadriceps."

Title: Holman Towel Burpee to Push-Up
Desc: Perform a burpee, then quickly jump into a plank position and lower your body until your quadriceps are fully extended.

Title: Holman Towel Right Side Squat
Desc: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a towel between hands. Perform a squat, keeping back straight and knees bent, targeting right quadriceps.

Title: ACFT Sprint-drag-carry
Desc: The sprint-drag-carry is a strength and endurance relay that is part of the new Army Combat Fitness Test or ACFT. It combines sprinting, reverse sled drag, side shuffle, and a farmer's carry to test overall strength and athletic conditioning. Practicing this relay as a drill is great for developing strenght, speed, endurance, and power, and can also be great conditioning work for lifters and athletes of all ability levels.

Title: Cable Hip Adduction
Desc: "Sit facing cable machine, cable at knee level. Loop handle around ankle. Slowly adduct leg against tension, then return to starting position."

Title: Cable Deadlifts
Desc: Stand over the cable, knees bent 90 degrees, toes pointing slightly outward. Slowly lower your body, keeping weight in heels, until hamstrings engage.

Title: KV Cable Squat
Desc: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a cable handle at hip level. Slowly lower into a squat, keeping back straight and knees bent at 90 degrees. Push through heels to return to standing.

Title: Single-Leg Press
Desc: The single-leg leg press is an exercise targeting the quadriceps one leg at a time. Many lifters prefer the leg press to squatting for several reasons, including the perception that it’s safer for the spine.

Title: Stair climber
Desc: The stair climber is a popular cardio machine found in most commercial gyms. Along with burning a ton of calories, the stair climber also helps build strength in the lower body, especially the glutes. It can work well at higher speeds for interval-style conditioning training, but also works well at slower paces for steady-state cardio.

Title: Leg Press
Desc: The leg press is a machine exercise targeting the quadriceps. It’s favorite among lifters who prefer the seated position to standing with a load on the spine.

Title: Elliptical trainer
Desc: The elliptical trainer is a popular machine for cardiovascular training without the significant impact on your joints of running. On many machines, you can adjust the resistance level to make the movement more difficult for all four limbs. The elliptical is a mainstay in most commercial gyms, and can be equally effective for HIIT-style interval workouts or for longer-duration endurance work.

Title: Narrow-stance leg press
Desc: The narrow-stance leg press is a machine-based exercise that targets the muscles of the legs. It emphasizes the quads, particularly the muscles of the outer quads and hips. It is often used as an accessory for squats, or as a muscle-building movement during lower-body training when it is usually performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more.

Title: Narrow Stance Hack Squats
Desc: "Sit on a hack squat machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and perform a narrow stance. Slowly lower yourself until your thighs are parallel to the ground, then stand up."

Title: Stairmaster
Desc: The stair climber is a popular cardio machine found in most commercial gyms. Along with burning a ton of calories, the stair climber also helps build strength in the lower body, especially the glutes. It can work well at higher speeds for interval-style conditioning training, but also works well at slower paces for steady-state cardio.

Title: Machine Squat
Desc: Sit on the machine with your back against the pad, then lower yourself by bending your knees, keeping your quadriceps in control. Push through your heels to return to standing.

Title: Smith machine back squat
Desc: The Smith machine back squat is a machine-based exercise targeting the muscles of the lower body. The Smith machine mimics a barbell but provides more stability. This movement can be programmed in low reps for strength or higher reps for muscle and strength endurance. It is often performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more, as part of a full-body or lower-body workout.

Title: Leg Extensions
Desc: The leg extension is an isolation exercise for the quads.

Title: Treadmill running
Desc: Treadmill running is a popular cardiovascular exercise performed on a machine that is available in most gyms. Performing this exercise on a treadmill allows you to adjust the speed of your running and, depending on the machine, perform it on an adjustable incline. Many machines also have built-in heart rate monitors and timers to help you track your progress.

Title: Stationary bike
Desc: The stationary bike is a popular cardio machine found in most commercial gyms. Along with burning a ton of calories, the stationary bike also helps develop the lower body. Stationary bikes come in multiple variations, ranging from ones that resemble riding a bike, to recumbent bikes, to fan bikes that work both the arms and the legs. No matter the variation, a stationary bike can work well at higher speeds for interval-style conditioning training, but also works well at slower paces for steady-state cardio.

Title: Treadmill jogging
Desc: Treadmill jogging is a popular cardiovascular exercise performed on a machine that is available in most gyms. Performing this exercise on a treadmill allows you to adjust the speed of your jogging and, depending on the machine, perform it on an adjustable incline. Many machines also have built-in heart rate monitors and timers to help you track your progress.

Title: Recumbent Bike
Desc: "Sitting on a recumbent bike, adjust the seat and pedals to fit your body. Hold onto handles and slowly pedal in a circular motion, targeting your quadriceps."

Title: Smith machine leg press
Desc: The Smith machine leg press is a machine-based movement that targets the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can serve as a substitute for the leg press or be programmed similarly to the leg press. It is usually performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more, as part of lower-body training. If your Smith machine has safety bars, set them at a height that allows you a full range of motion while giving adequate protection from the weight potentially falling.

Title: Lying Machine Squat
Desc: Sit comfortably on a leg machine with feet shoulder-width apart, then slowly lower and raise your legs in a squatting motion to target quadriceps.

Title: Seated Leg Press
Desc: The seated leg press is a lower body exercise that targets the quads, adductors, glutes, and hamstrings.

Title: Smith machine pistol squat
Desc: The Smith machine pistol squat is a machine-based exercise that targets the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It is similar in form to a pistol squat but is performed with a bar on the shoulders. This adds extra resistance, but also eliminates some of the balance challenge of single-leg squats. This squat variation can be performed in low reps for strength or for higher reps for muscle gain.

Title: Leverage Deadlift
Desc: Sit on a leg press machine with feet shoulder-width apart, then extend knees to lift weight up. Control descent, squeezing quads at top.

Title: Leg press-
Desc: The leg press is a machine exercise targeting the leg muscles, including the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It's a favorite among lifters who prefer the seated position to standing with a load on the spine. The leg press is often used as an accessory for squats or deadlifts, but can also be the main lower-body movement in a workout. It is often performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more.

Title: TBS Hack Squat
Desc: The hack squat is a machine-based exercise that targets the muscles of the legs, particularly the quadriceps. It is often used as an accessory for squats, but can also be the main lower-body movement in a workout. It is often performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more.

Title: Leg Extensions - Gethin Variation
Desc: The leg extension is an isolation exercise for the quads.

Title: Seated leg press-
Desc: The seated leg press is a machine-based exercise that targets the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It is similar in many ways to larger leg press machines, but often utilizes a selectorized weight stack rather than plate loading. Leg press variations are often used as an accessory for squats or deadlifts, but can also be the main lower-body movement in a workout. This movement is often performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more.

Title: Smith machine front squat
Desc: The Smith machine front squat is a machine-based exercise targeting the muscles of the lower body. The Smith machine mimics a barbell but provides more stability. This movement can be programmed in low reps for strength or higher reps for muscle and strength endurance. It is often performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more, as part of a full-body or lower-body workout.

Title: Machine Deadlift - Gethin Variation
Desc: "Sit at the machine, grasping handles with feet shoulder-width apart. Slowly lift knees up, squeezing quads as you stand."

Title: Single-leg hack squat
Desc: The single-leg hack squat is a lower-body exercise mainly targeting the quads, performed one side at a time per set. It is often used as an accessory for squats, or as a muscle-building movement during lower-body training, and is usually performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more.

Title: Narrow-stance hack squat
Desc: The narrow-stance hack squat is a machine-based exercise that targets the muscles of the legs, particularly the quadriceps. It is often used as an accessory for squats, or as a muscle-building movement during lower-body training, and is usually performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more.

Title: Alternating Single-Leg Curl - Gethin Variation
Desc: "Sitting on a leg curl machine, lift one foot off the platform and curl it up towards your glutes. Alternate legs with each rep."

Title: Stiff-Legged Deadlift - Gethin Variation
Desc: The barbell stiff-legged deadlift targets the hamstrings, glutes, lower and upper back, as well as the core. It is a popular accessory movement for the deadlift, but also a muscle-building hamstring movement.

Title: Single-Leg Press - Gethin Variation
Desc: The single-leg leg press is an exercise targeting the quadriceps one leg at a time. Many lifters prefer the leg press to squatting for several reasons, including the perception that it’s safer for the spine.

Title: Hack squat-
Desc: The hack squat is a machine-based exercise that targets the muscles of the legs, particularly the quadriceps. It is often used as an accessory for squats, but can also be the main lower-body movement in a workout. It is often performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more.

Title: Smith machine lunge squat
Desc: The Smith machine lunge squat is an exercise targeting the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. Using added weight allows you to overload the exercise beyond body weight and perform the movement in strength ranges. The Smith machine mimics a barbell but provides more stability.

Title: Hack Squat - Gethin Variation
Desc: The hack squat is a machine-based exercise that targets the muscles of the legs, particularly the quadriceps. It is often used as an accessory for squats, but can also be the main lower-body movement in a workout. It is often performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more.

Title: Leg Press - Gethin Variation
Desc: The leg press is a machine exercise targeting the quadriceps. It’s favorite among lifters who prefer the seated position to standing with a load on the spine.

Title: AM Leg Press
Desc: The leg press is a machine exercise targeting the quadriceps. It’s favorite among lifters who prefer the seated position to standing with a load on the spine.

Title: Leg extension
Desc: The leg extension is a popular machine-based exercise for the legs, particularly the quadriceps. It is usually performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more, as part of a leg pre-exhaust or as a muscle-building movement for lower-body training.

Title: UP Quad Extension
Desc: The leg extension is an isolation exercise for the quads.

Title: UP Single-Leg Press
Desc: The single-leg leg press is an exercise targeting the quadriceps one leg at a time. Many lifters prefer the leg press to squatting for several reasons, including the perception that it’s safer for the spine.

Title: UP Leg Press
Desc: The leg press is a machine exercise targeting the quadriceps. It’s favorite among lifters who prefer the seated position to standing with a load on the spine.

Title: Pop Squat On Leg Press
Desc: "Sit comfortably on leg press machine, feet shoulder-width apart on platform. Slowly lower yourself down by extending knees, then push back up to starting position."

Title: King Maker Leg Press
Desc: The leg press is a machine exercise targeting the quadriceps. It’s favorite among lifters who prefer the seated position to standing with a load on the spine.

Title: Single-leg leg press
Desc: The single-leg leg press is a machine exercise targeting the leg muscles, including the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. The leg press is often used as an accessory for squats or deadlifts, but can also be the main lower-body movement in a workout. It is often performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more.

Title: King Maker Hack Squat
Desc: The hack squat is a machine-based exercise that targets the muscles of the legs, particularly the quadriceps. It is often used as an accessory for squats, but can also be the main lower-body movement in a workout. It is often performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more.

Title: 30 Legs Feet-High Leg Press
Desc: "Sit comfortably on the leg press machine, feet high on the platform, and push the weight away from you by extending your legs. Slowly lower back to start."

Title: 30 Legs Leg Press
Desc: "Sit at a leg press machine with feet shoulder-width apart on platform, then lift and extend legs, squeezing quadriceps. Slowly lower back down."

Title: 30 Legs Leg Press Calf Raise
Desc: "Sit on a leg press machine with feet shoulder-width apart on platform. Push through quadriceps to extend legs, then raise calf muscles for added emphasis."

Title: 30 Legs Lying Leg Curl
Desc: "Sit at a lying leg curl machine with knees bent and feet resting on pad. Lift legs up, then slowly lower them back down, targeting quadriceps."

Title: 30 Legs Machine Hack Squat
Desc: "Sit in a leg machine and adjust the pad to target your quadriceps. Keeping back straight, slowly lower yourself down, then stand up and repeat."

Title: 30 Legs Single-Leg Leg Extension
Desc: "Sit on machine with leg extended, lift single leg off platform, keeping knee straight. Slowly lower and raise leg without touching platform, targeting quadriceps."

Title: 30 Legs Single-Leg Leg Press
Desc: "Sit comfortably on the leg press machine, lift one leg off the platform and extend it straight. Slowly lower your leg without touching the floor, then push back to the starting position."

Title: 30 Legs Single-Leg Lying Leg Curl
Desc: "Lie on a lying leg curl machine with legs extended. Lift one leg up, curling it towards your glutes, then slowly lower back to start. Repeat on the other side."

Title: 30 Legs Smith Machine Split Squat
Desc: "Stand over Smith machine, facing away from it. Place right foot on platform and left foot behind. Lower body down until back knee almost touches ground, then push back up to starting position."

Title: 30 Legs Smith Machine Squat
Desc: "Stand over the Smith machine with feet shoulder-width apart, grip handles firmly. Lower body down into a squat, keeping back straight and knees in line with toes. Push through heels to return to standing."

Title: Jumping rope
Desc: Jumping rope is a classic conditioning exercise that is popular with everyone from children to boxers to CrossFit athletes. It targets many different muscles, including the calves, glutes, shoulders, and upper back, and is great for everything from fat loss to improving overall athletic performance.

Title: Forward lunge
Desc: The forward lunge is a lower-body bodyweight exercise targeting the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can also be performed holding dumbbells or other weights. The forward lunge places more emphasis on the quads than other lunge variations. It can be performed for time or reps in the lower-body portion of any workout.

Title: Side-to-side box skip
Desc: The side-to-side box skip is an explosive lower-body exercise that involves jumping laterally over a bench or box, landing with one foot on top of the surface, and then switching positions. It primarily targets the muscles of the lower body, but is also a serious cardiovascular challenge. It is often performed for high reps or for time as part of a fat-loss or athleticism-focused workout or circuit.

Title: Bodyweight squat
Desc: The bodyweight squat is a fundamental exercise that strengthens the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can be performed as part of a dynamic warm-up, for time or reps during a workout, or for hip and spine mobility any time.

Title: Broad jump
Desc: The broad jump is an explosive lower-body exercise. It is a common way to measure explosive hip and lower-body strength in athletes. The more explosive you are, the farther you'll be able to jump.

Title: Burpee
Desc: The burpee is a high-intensity exercise that recruits the entire body to build strength and aerobic capacity. It is common in CrossFit workouts and group fitness classes, but can also be performed for time or reps in any fat-loss or athleticism-focused circuit or workout.

Title: Trail Running/Walking
Desc: "Engage quadriceps by quickly ascending and descending varied terrain, focusing on explosive knee drive and controlled descent."

Title: Scissors Jump
Desc: The alternating lunge jump is an explosive bodyweight exercise that targets the lower-body muscles, including the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can be performed for time or reps in power training, and is also effective in any fat-loss or athleticism-focused workout.

Title: Jumping jack-
Desc: The jumping jack is a classic calisthenics exercise to improve overall conditioning. It’s one the most recognizable exercises on the planet, and it’s almost synonymous with training for military recruits. It can be done for time or reps, often in dynamic warm-ups or to mobilize the hips and shoulders.

Title: Arms-crossed jump squat
Desc: The arms-crossed jump squat is an explosive version of the jump squat. Crossing your arms eliminates any extra power that could come from swinging your arms, making the movement extra strict and challenging for the lower body. It can be performed for time or reps and is especially effective in a fat-loss or athleticism-focused circuit or workout.

Title: Bodyweight Reverse Lunge
Desc: The reverse lunge is a lower-body exercise targeting the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. The reverse lunge places more emphasis on the glutes than other lunge variations.

Title: Alien Squat
Desc: "Drop down into a squat, explosively extending legs to jump height. Quickly lower back to start position, targeting quadriceps."

Title: Treadmill walking
Desc: Treadmill walking is a popular cardiovascular exercise performed on a machine that is available in most gyms. Performing this exercise on a treadmill allows you to adjust the speed of your walking and, depending on the machine, perform it on an adjustable incline. Many machines also have built-in heart rate monitors and timers to help you track your progress.

Title: Rocket Jump
Desc: Jumping up explosively, land softly on balls of feet and immediately jump again, emphasizing quadriceps contraction.

Title: Depth jump box jump
Desc: The depth jump box jump is a plyometric exercise that entails jumping off one box, dropping into a squat, and then jumping up onto another box. These are all performed fluidly to complete one rep. Depth jumps have been a staple of high-level athletic programming for decades. They are usually performed for low reps with a focus on power and technique. If they hurt your knees or back, consider performing box jumps or squat jumps instead.

Title: Bodyweight Walking Lunge
Desc: The walking lunge is a lower-body exercise that targets the glutes, quads, and hamstrings while challenging stability and balance. It can be performed for reps, time, or distance in the lower-body portion of any workout.

Title: Walking High Knees
Desc: "Walk quickly, lifting one knee towards your chest while keeping the other foot on the ground. Alternate legs and engage quadriceps to challenge yourself."

Title: Lateral lunge
Desc: The lateral lunge is a lower-body bodyweight movement that works the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can also be performed holding dumbbells or other weights. It is often performed for reps as part of a dynamic warm-up or mobility routine but can also work in a circuit or other workouts.

Title: Jump Squat
Desc: The jump squat is an explosive bodyweight exercise targeting the quads, hamstrings, and glutes. It is also a serious cardiovascular challenge when done for reps. It can be performed as a power exercise to build jumping power, or in any fat-loss or athleticism-focused workout.

Title: Over bench jump
Desc: The over bench jump is a plyometric exercise requiring only a weight bench to perform. It improves jumping ability and athleticism while burning a lot of calories.

Title: Split Jump
Desc: The alternating lunge jump is an explosive bodyweight exercise that targets the lower-body muscles, including the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can be performed for time or reps in power training, and is also effective in any fat-loss or athleticism-focused workout.

Title: 90-degree jump squat
Desc: The 90-degree jump squat is an explosive bodyweight exercise that targets the muscles of the lower body, including the quads, glutes, and hamstrings, as well as the cardiovascular system. It can be performed for time or reps, usually in a fat-loss or athleticism-focused circuit workout.

Title: Skip
Desc: The skip is an exercise that builds power and explosiveness in the legs. It's commonly performed by children and in gym classes, but is also great for working the legs and hip flexors, making it a favorite warm-up for athletes who need to explode vertically.

Title: Kneeling hip flexor stretch
Desc: The kneeling hip flexor stretch is a stretch targeting greater flexibility in the front side of the hips. It targets a chronically tight muscle group and is often performed as part of a dynamic warm-up, a cool-down, or as recovery work after training.

Title: Iron Crosses (stretch)
Desc: "Hold an iron cross position, keeping legs straight and lifting one leg towards ceiling. Gently stretch quadriceps, maintaining balance."

Title: All Fours Quad Stretch
Desc: Start on all fours, slowly lift one knee toward ceiling, keeping other leg bent at 90 degrees. Hold, then release. Repeat on opposite side.

Title: Lying quad stretch with band
Desc: The lying quad stretch with band is a simple way to stretch a chronically tight muscle group of the lower body. It is common in stretching and yoga classes but can also be performed individually as part of a warm-up, paired with movements in a workout, or as part of a cool-down or recovery strategy.

Title: One Half Locust
Desc: "From a prone position, lift one leg towards the ceiling, keeping knee straight, and hold for 15-30 seconds. Focus on stretching quadriceps."

Title: Standing Hip Flexors
Desc: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, then lift one knee toward chest while keeping back straight and core engaged. Hold for 30 seconds, switching sides.

Title: Looking At Ceiling
Desc: Stand tall, lift one leg behind you, keeping knee straight, and gaze up at ceiling. Hold for 30 seconds, then switch sides.

Title: Rear Leg Raises
Desc: Lying on your back, lift one leg straight up towards the ceiling, keeping knee straight. Hold briefly, then lower slowly. Repeat on opposite side.

Title: On Your Side Quad Stretch
Desc: Lie on your side, bend knee to 90 degrees, and grab ankle with hand. Pull heel towards buttocks until stretch is felt in front of leg.

Title: On-Your-Back Quad Stretch
Desc: Lie on your back, lift one leg straight up towards ceiling, hold for 30 seconds, and gently pull toward your head to stretch quadriceps.

Title: Standing Elevated Quad Stretch
Desc: Stand near a sturdy chair, raise one leg onto it, and lean forward to stretch the quadriceps. Keep knee straight and hold for 20-30 seconds.

Title: Thigh killa
Desc: The thigh killa is a challenging lower-body bodyweight exercise that builds muscular endurance with a series of hops and bodyweight squats. It can be performed for time or reps, usually in a circuit workout or as a lower-body finisher.

Title: Southpaw sprawl
Desc: The southpaw sprawl is a full-body movement that combines elements of a single-arm plank and a sprawl. It also has a rotational component, with a jumping leg-cross and torso twist in a single-arm plank position. It is a challenging move that trains balance, core strength, and many muscle groups, making it work well in a time-efficient bodyweight circuit workout.

Title: Stride Jump Crossover
Desc: "Stand with feet hip-width apart, explosively jump and cross one foot over the other while extending the opposite knee, training quadriceps with plyometric power."

Title: Side Standing Long Jump
Desc: "Start standing sideways, bend knees and explosively jump to the opposite side, landing on same foot. Quickly return to starting position."

Title: Wall squat
Desc: The wall squat is a bodyweight exercise targeting the quadriceps, as well as other muscles in the lower body and core. The lifter's back is flat against a wall, and the back slides down and up the wall during each rep. If you don't have a smooth wall to slide on, the exercise can also be performed with an exercise ball between the back and the wall.

Title: Slide Jump Shot
Desc: "Jump into a squat, explosively extending your legs and sending yourself sliding forward. Quick transition back to start."

Title: Sprawl frog kick
Desc: The sprawl frog kick is an explosive bodyweight exercise that targets multiple muscle groups across the upper and lower body. It is similar to a traditional sprawl, but with an extra hop in the middle of each rep. It can be performed for time or reps in any fat-loss or athleticism-focused circuit or workout.

Title: Lateral Speed Step
Desc: "Quickly step sideways while keeping knees bent, transferring weight from one foot to the other. Focus on rapid, controlled movements to engage quadriceps."

Title: Side Hop-Sprint
Desc: "Jump sideways, landing softly on the ball of one foot, then immediately sprint in place, targeting quadriceps activation and explosive power."

Title: Pop squat
Desc: The pop squat is an explosive bodyweight exercise that targets the lower-body muscles, including the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It is similar to a jump squat, but alternates between a narrow and wide stance with each jump. It can be performed for time or reps in power training and is also effective in any fat-loss or athleticism-focused workout.

Title: Star Jump
Desc: "Jump explosively, landing softly on both feet with knees bent to train quadriceps. Quickly repeat, focusing on powerful leg drive."

Title: Side Lunge Touching Heel
Desc: The side lunge cross-body heel-touch is a lower-body exercise targeting the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. The heel-touch adds a slight rotational challenge.

Title: Lying Prone Quadriceps
Desc: Lying prone, bend one knee towards chest while keeping other leg straight. Gently pull bent knee toward head until stretch is felt in front of the straight leg. Hold and release slowly.

Title: Fast Kick With Arm Circles
Desc: "Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, then quickly lift one leg in a kicking motion while simultaneously moving arms in small circles. Focus on quadriceps engagement."

Title: Single-leg box squat
Desc: The single-leg box squat is a bodyweight exercise that targets the muscles of the lower body, including the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It is similar in form to a pistol squat, except that you sit to a box. This allows you to customize the depth of the movement to your movement abilities and mobility level. For this reason, the single-leg box squat is a popular movement for building leg strength in beginning trainees. It can be performed in lower strength-focused rep ranges, such as 5-8 reps per leg, or for higher reps for muscle building.

Title: Defensive Slide
Desc: Slide into a low position, keeping back straight and knees bent at 90 degrees, then quickly slide back up to standing, engaging quadriceps.

Title: Quick Leap
Desc: "Start in a squat position, then explosively leap forward, landing softly on the ball of your foot and immediately jumping again. Repeat quickly."

Title: Vertical Mountain Climber
Desc: Start in a plank position, engage core and alternate bringing one knee up towards chest while keeping other foot on ground.

Title: Reverse Burpee
Desc: "Start in a plank position, then explosively kick back into a squat, before rapidly returning to standing and jumping up. Repeat quickly, targeting your quadriceps."

Title: Football Up-Down
Desc: "Start in a plank position, then quickly alternate bringing each knee up towards chest, mimicking football running motions. Focus on quick transitions and strong leg engagement."

Title: Jump lunge heel kick
Desc: The jump lunge heel kick is a high-intensity, full-body exercise targeting the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It combines a jump lunge with a standing hamstring stretch in a unique combo that also challenges balance. It can be performed for time or reps as part of a fat-loss or athleticism-focused circuit or workout.

Title: Burpee box jump
Desc: The burpee box jump is an explosive bodyweight exercise that combines a burpee with a leap onto a box or step. First, you perform a traditional burpee, and then instead of jumping into the air, you jump onto a box. This makes you focus on power generation in the jump, making each rep more challenging. Burpee box jumps are often performed for high reps as part of metabolic conditioning circuits or workouts.

Title: Linear Depth Jump
Desc: "Drop into a quarter squat, explosively jump and immediately lower back down to absorb impact, training quadriceps' ability to decelerate quickly."

Title: Slow Jog
Desc: Stand with feet hip-width apart, then slowly jog in place, keeping knees bent to engage quadriceps and maintain a smooth pace.

Title: High knees
Desc: High knees is a full-body, cardio-based exercise with an emphasis on the lower body. It is often performed for reps or time as part of a dynamic warm-up.

Title: Jumping Jack
Desc: The jumping jack is a classic calisthenics exercise to improve overall conditioning. It’s one the most recognizable exercises on the planet, and it’s almost synonymous with training for military recruits. It can be done for time or reps, often in dynamic warm-ups or to mobilize the hips and shoulders.

Title: Square Hop
Desc: "Squat down, then explosively jump up and land softly on the balls of your feet, using your quadriceps to propel you upward."

Title: Running lunge
Desc: The running lunge is a dynamic exercise that targets the lower body. It combines elements of a reverse lunge with a step-up, in that the front leg fully extends and the rear leg flexes up in front of the body. It targets a wide range of muscles in the lower body, including the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can be performed for time or reps in any lower-body workout, or in a fat-loss or athleticism-focused circuit.

Title: In-out jump squat
Desc: The in-out jump squat is a bodyweight squat variation that alternates wide and narrow jump squats. It targets the lower-body muscles, including the quads, glutes, adductors, and hamstrings, and also provides a serious cardiovascular challenge. It can be performed for time or reps and is especially effective in a fat-loss or athleticism-focused circuit or workout.

Title: Gorilla squat
Desc: The gorilla squat is a bodyweight sequence that combines two reverse lunges and a bodyweight squat. It could also be performed with dumbbells, kettlebells, or other weights. It targets most of the muscles of the lower body, including the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can be performed for time or reps in the lower-body portion of any workout.

Title: Burpee tuck jump
Desc: The burpee tuck jump is an explosive version of the burpee exercise that adds a tuck jump to the top of each rep. It can be performed for time or reps in any fat-loss or athleticism-focused circuit or workout.

Title: Speed skater
Desc: The speed skater is an explosive version of the lateral lunge that involves jumping from side to side and landing on a single leg, then touching the ground. It challenges the lower-body muscles, including the quads, hips, and glutes, and the cardiovascular system, while training lateral movement.

Title: Jumping knee up-down
Desc: The jumping knee up-down is an explosive bodyweight movement that consists of a knee up-down followed by a jump squat. It targets the muscles of the lower body, including the quads, glutes, and hamstrings, but is also a challenging power and conditioning exercise.

Title: Jump Lunge To Feet Jack
Desc: Jump into a lunge position, explosively extending legs and transferring weight to the back foot as you "jack" your front knee towards your chest.

Title: Reverse Lunge Rotation
Desc: "Stand with feet together, take a large step back with one foot and lower body until both knees are bent at 90 degrees. Rotate torso and switch arms to challenge quadriceps."

Title: Alternating standing knee-pull stretch
Desc: The alternating standing knee-pull stretch targets range of motion in the hips, hamstrings, and lower back. It's a common movement in dynamic warm-ups for athletics or lower-body training, but can also be used to "limber up" for activity anytime.

Title: Seal jack
Desc: The seal jack is a variation on the jumping jack, one the most common calisthenic exercises on the planet. The difference between this movement and the jumping jack has to do with the arm motion. Instead of the arms coming together overhead, they come together in front of the body, like a seal clapping its fins.

Title: Kneeling quad thoracic stretch
Desc: The kneeling quad thoracic stretch is a stretch targeting greater range of motion in your thoracic spine. It is commonly included in dynamic warm-ups or cool-downs, but can also be performed as full-body mobility work any time.

Title: Single-Leg Squat With Knee Tap
Desc: The single-leg knee-tap squat is a single-leg squat variation that involves “floating” the back leg over the ground on the descent until touching just the knee to the ground or a pad. It is similar to a lunge, but without touching the back foot to the ground. It is an intense strength and coordination challenge that can work in any strength- or athleticism-focused workout.

Title: Shuttle run
Desc: The shuttle run is an athletic conditioning drill that’s great for developing speed and power, as well as changing direction. It’s a favorite of football and basketball players, but it can also be great conditioning work for lifters and athletes of all ability levels.

Title: Squat Isometric Hold
Desc: The hack squat is a machine-based exercise that targets the muscles of the legs, particularly the quadriceps. It is often used as an accessory for squats, but can also be the main lower-body movement in a workout. It is often performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more.

Title: Wall sit
Desc: The wall sit is an exercise targeting the quadriceps and core muscle. It involves descending into a squat position while leaning against a wall, then holding that position for a predetermined length of time. It's a classic leg endurance-building exercise for basketball players and gymnasts.

Title: Walking lunge with hip extension
Desc: The walking lunge with hip extension is a combination of two movements, both targeting the lower body. The added hip extension places more of an emphasis on the glutes. It is a great inclusion in a dynamic warm-up for the lower body, but can also be performed for time or reps in any workout.

Title: Squat with alternating side leg raise
Desc: The squat with alternating side leg raise is a bodyweight version of the squat, but with a lateral leg lift to add extra focus to the abductor muscles. It can be performed for time or for reps as part of a dynamic warm-up for the lower body, or in any lower-body portion of a workout.

Title: Lateral Squats
Desc: The lateral lunge is a lower-body bodyweight movement that works the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can also be performed holding dumbbells or other weights. It is often performed for reps as part of a dynamic warm-up or mobility routine but can also work in a circuit or other workouts.

Title: Walking lunge with twist
Desc: The walking lunge with twist is an exercise that targets the lower body and the obliques. The twist not only works the obliques, it also opens up the thoracic spine. It is a great inclusion in a dynamic warm-up for a lower-body or full-body workout, but can also be performed for time or reps in any workout.

Title: Boss Everline Backward Lunge Walk
Desc: "Walk backwards, keeping back knee bent at 90 degrees and front thigh parallel to ground, engaging quadriceps. Alternate legs in slow steps."

Title: Reverse Diagonal Skaters
Desc: Slide backwards while keeping one foot in place, alternate legs and keep knees bent to engage quadriceps and build strength.

Title: FYR Air Squat
Desc: The bodyweight squat is a fundamental exercise that strengthens the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can be performed as part of a dynamic warm-up, for time or reps during a workout, or for hip and spine mobility any time.

Title: FYR Tuck Jump
Desc: The tuck jump is a vertical jump, an explosive lower-body exercise that is a common way to measure explosive hip and lower-body strength in athletes. The more explosive you are, the higher you'll be able to jump.

Title: Push-up sprawl tuck jump
Desc: The push-up sprawl tuck jump is an explosive bodyweight sequence that combines three movements: the push-up, the sprawl, and the tuck jump. It is similar to a burpee, but with a tuck jump at the top. It can be performed for time or reps in any fat-loss or athleticism-focused circuit or workout.

Title: FYR Running Lunge
Desc: The running lunge is a dynamic exercise that targets the lower body. It combines elements of a reverse lunge with a step-up, in that the front leg fully extends and the rear leg flexes up in front of the body. It targets a wide range of muscles in the lower body, including the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can be performed for time or reps in any lower-body workout, or in a fat-loss or athleticism-focused circuit.

Title: FYR Jumping Lunge
Desc: The alternating lunge jump is an explosive bodyweight exercise that targets the lower-body muscles, including the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can be performed for time or reps in power training, and is also effective in any fat-loss or athleticism-focused workout.

Title: FYR Sprawl Frog Kick
Desc: The sprawl frog kick is an explosive bodyweight exercise that targets multiple muscle groups across the upper and lower body. It is similar to a traditional sprawl, but with an extra hop in the middle of each rep. It can be performed for time or reps in any fat-loss or athleticism-focused circuit or workout.

Title: Jump squat-
Desc: The jump squat is an explosive bodyweight exercise targeting the quads, hamstrings, and glutes. It is also a serious cardiovascular challenge when done for reps. It can be performed as a power exercise to build jumping power, or in any fat-loss or athleticism-focused workout.

Title: FYR Sprinter Burpee
Desc: "Drop down into a squat position, kick back into a plank, do a push-up, quickly return to squat and jump up. Repeat for maximum intensity."

Title: Single-leg burpee
Desc: The single-leg burpee is an advanced variation of the burpee exercise that involves performing all parts of the sequence with one leg at a time. It is usually performed alternating legs with each rep, but could be performed one side at a time. Performing one leg at a time increases the challenge to all parts of the body, especially the working leg, core, and shoulders.

Title: FYR Gorilla Squat
Desc: The gorilla squat is a bodyweight sequence that combines two reverse lunges and a bodyweight squat. It could also be performed with dumbbells, kettlebells, or other weights. It targets most of the muscles of the lower body, including the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can be performed for time or reps in the lower-body portion of any workout.

Title: Banded compass jump squat
Desc: The banded compass jump squat is an explosive squat variation performed with a band around the thighs just above the knees. This increases muscle activation in the hips and glutes, while the squat targets the quads, hamstrings, and glutes. The landing for each jump is a 90-degree rotation from the starting position. The banded compass jump squat can be performed for low reps as a power-focused exercise, or for higher reps to build muscle in the lower body, challenge conditioning, and burn fat.

Title: In-out sprawl
Desc: The in-out sprawl is a full-body movement that combines elements of a plank and a sprawl. It demands an explosive full-body jump from a plank position. It is a challenging move that trains balance, core strength, and many muscle groups, making it work well in a time-efficient bodyweight circuit workout.

Title: Knee-tuck kick-up
Desc: The knee-tuck kick-up is a bodyweight movement that targets the muscles of the abs, the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles in particular. It can be performed for time or reps in the ab-focused portion of any workout.

Title: Bear crawl donkey kick
Desc: The bear crawl donkey kick is a more advanced version of the bear crawl exercise that adds a donkey kick. It adds an extra coordination and shoulder challenge to an already intense full-body movement that targets the cardiovascular system as well as a wide range of muscle groups, the shoulders, core, and legs in particular. It can be done as a full-body warm-up, in short bursts for power or circuit training, or for longer durations as cardiovascular conditioning.

Title: Southpaw sprawl with push-up
Desc: The southpaw sprawl with push-up is a full-body movement that combines elements of a plank and a sprawl, with the addition of a push-up. It also has a rotational component, with a jumping leg-cross and torso twist in a straight-arm plank position. It is a challenging move that trains balance, core strength, and many muscle groups, making it work well in a time-efficient bodyweight circuit workout.

Title: Bouncing lunge
Desc: The bouncing lunge is a bodyweight movement targeting the quads. It can be performed either for time or reps, and is often included as part of a fat-loss or athleticism-focused circuit workout.

Title: Bodyweight Squat - Gethin Variation
Desc: The bodyweight squat is a fundamental exercise that strengthens the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can be performed as part of a dynamic warm-up, for time or reps during a workout, or for hip and spine mobility any time.

Title: FYR Alternating Lunge
Desc: The forward lunge is a lower-body bodyweight exercise targeting the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can also be performed holding dumbbells or other weights. The forward lunge places more emphasis on the quads than other lunge variations. It can be performed for time or reps in the lower-body portion of any workout.

Title: Bodyweight Walking Lunge - Gethin Variation
Desc: The walking lunge is a lower-body exercise that targets the glutes, quads, and hamstrings while challenging stability and balance. It can be performed for reps, time, or distance in the lower-body portion of any workout.

Title: Seated Quad Contraction
Desc: "Sitting with legs straight, squeeze quadriceps without moving legs. Hold for a count, then release."

Title: HM Squat with Alternating Leg Extension
Desc: "Hold a squat position, then extend one leg straight out while keeping the other bent at 90 degrees. Alternate legs in a controlled motion."

Title: HM Air Squat
Desc: Stand with feet hip-width apart, engage core and descend into a squat, keeping back straight and knees behind toes. Push through heels to return to standing position.

Title: HM Alternating Jump Lunge
Desc: "Stand with feet hip-width apart, alternating jumping between feet while lowering into a lunge, targeting quadriceps; powerful, explosive movement."

Title: HM Alternating Lunge-In-Place
Desc: "Stand with feet hip-width apart, engage core, and alternate bringing one knee towards chest while keeping other leg straight. Hold for a brief moment before switching sides."

Title: HM Alternating Side Lunge
Desc: Stand with feet hip-width apart, take a large step to one side and lower body until back knee almost touches ground. Push back up to starting position, alternating sides.

Title: HM Sumo Pulse
Desc: "Start in a sumo stance, engage quadriceps, and pulse knees towards chest while keeping back straight and core tight, then return to starting position."

Title: HM Sumo Squat
Desc: Stand with feet wide apart, then bend knees and hips to lower body down until thighs parallel to ground. Push through heels to return to standing.

Title: HM Alternating Side-Kick
Desc: "Lie on your side, lift leg straight up, then kick out to opposite side, keeping knee bent. Alternate sides for a powerful quadriceps workout."

Title: HM Tuck-Up Burpee
Desc: "Drop down into a squat position, tucking knees up and hands on ground. From this position, kick back into a plank, then explosively return to standing, engaging quadriceps throughout."

Title: HM Bear Crawl
Desc: "Start in a plank position, engage core and lower body to bear crawl position. Drag hands forward while keeping knees bent, targeting quadriceps."

Title: HM Bear Stance Fire Hydrant
Desc: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, shift weight onto one leg while keeping other leg straight. Lower into a lunge position, then explosively drive back up to starting stance.

Title: HM Walking Frankenstein
Desc: "Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, engage core and descend into a squat, keeping back straight. Slowly walk forward, keeping knees bent at 90 degrees, emphasizing quadriceps contraction."

Title: HM Walking Hip Stretch
Desc: "Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, take a large step forward with one foot and bend front knee. Lean forward, stretching quadriceps, then switch sides."

Title: HM Wide Jump Squat
Desc: "Start with feet shoulder-width apart, then jump wide and lower into a squat, keeping back straight and knees in line with toes. Explode upward, landing softly on the balls of your feet."

Title: HM Boxer Shuffle
Desc: "Start in a squat position, shuffle feet quickly and simultaneously while keeping knees bent at 90 degrees. Focus on explosive power from quadriceps."

Title: HM Running Lunge
Desc: "Start in a lunge position, take a large step forward and lower your body until back knee almost touches ground. Quickly alternate legs while maintaining proper form."

Title: HM Bulgarian Split Squat On Chair
Desc: Stand behind a chair, lift one leg back and sit down on the chair's edge. Lower your body until your front thigh is parallel to the floor, then stand up straight. Repeat with alternate legs.

Title: HM Burpee
Desc: "Start in a squat position, kick back into a plank, quickly return to squat, and explosively jump up. Quickly repeat."

Title: HM Butterfly
Desc: Lie on your back, arms extended overhead, and lift legs into a butterfly position, squeezing quadriceps to control movement.

Title: HM Alternating Lunge Push-Up
Desc: "Start in a plank position, alternating between left and right lunges while performing a push-up. Lower body down until chest almost touches ground, then push back up to starting position."

Title: HM Comet
Desc: "From a standing position, lower into a half-squat, then explosively jump up and land softly on the balls of your feet, engaging your quadriceps."

Title: HM Couch Stretch
Desc: Sit on a couch or bench, slowly sliding your legs forward while keeping knees straight. Hold for 30 seconds, feeling quadriceps stretch.

Title: HM Down Up
Desc: Lower your body into a lunge, then explosively push back up to standing, alternating legs in a continuous motion.

Title: HM Duck Walk
Desc: "Walk sideways, keeping one leg bent at 90 degrees and the other straight, shifting weight between legs while engaging quadriceps."

Title: HM Fragon
Desc: "Assume a plank position, engage core and slowly lower body until knees almost touch ground, then explosively straighten legs to return to starting position."

Title: HM Frankenstein
Desc: "Hold a wall or chair for support, then bend one knee while keeping the other straight, lowering body 6-8 inches. Slowly stand, extending leg."

Title: HM Single-Leg Squat on Chair
Desc: Stand on one leg, holding onto chair for balance, lower body until knee bends and then stand up, targeting quadriceps.

Title: HM Single-Leg Touchdown
Desc: "Stand on one leg, bend knee, and lower body until thigh parallel to ground. Push through heel to return to standing, focusing on quadriceps activation."

Title: HM Speed Skater
Desc: "Start in a plank position, then rapidly switch legs to mimic speed skating. Focus on quick turnover and explosive quadriceps contraction."

Title: HM Squat Jump
Desc: "Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, then lower into a squat and explosively jump up, landing softly on the balls of your feet. Repeat, engaging quadriceps and building strength."

Title: HM Squat Lunge
Desc: "Stand with feet hip-width apart, lunge forward with one leg while keeping back knee almost touching ground. Lower body until front thigh is parallel to ground, then push back up."

Title: HM Garland Pose
Desc: Assume a tabletop position on hands and toes, engage quadriceps, and hold steady for 30 seconds to build strength in your upper legs.

Title: HM High Knees
Desc: "Run in place, lifting knees high towards chest while keeping back straight and engaging quadriceps. Focus on quick turnover to maximize strength training."

Title: HM In-And-Out Squat
Desc: "Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, then lower into a squat, keeping back straight and knees out. Pause, then explosively stand up, squeezing quadriceps at the top."

Title: HM In-And-Out Squat Jump
Desc: "Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, then lower into a squat and explosively jump up, landing softly on the balls of your feet, targeting quadriceps activation."

Title: HM Jumping Jack
Desc: "Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, then jump and spread legs while raising arms above head; immediately return to starting position, engaging quadriceps throughout."

Title: HM Jumping Knee-Up
Desc: "From a standing position, explosively jump and lift one knee up towards your chest while keeping the other foot on the ground. Quickly return to the starting position."

Title: HM Jumping Rope
Desc: Jump rope quickly, using explosive power to engage quadriceps and drive knees up towards chest in a controlled motion.

Title: HM Right Calf-Spike Sumo Pulse
Desc: "Squat on right leg, extend left leg behind. Pulse left foot off ground, keeping right calf taut. Alternate legs in a controlled sumo movement."

Title: HM Reverse Lunge with Kick
Desc: Stand with feet hip-width apart, take a large step back with one foot and lower body until back knee almost touches ground. Kick forward with front leg while keeping back straight, then return to standing position.

Title: HM Left Knee-Up
Desc: Lying on your back, lift left leg straight up towards ceiling, keeping knee bent at 90 degrees. Slowly lower and repeat for controlled movement. Focus on quadriceps engagement.

Title: HM Left-Leg Lunge And Kick-Out
Desc: "Stand with feet hip-width apart, step out left foot and lower body until back knee almost touches ground. Push back up to starting position, then extend left leg straight out behind you."

Title: HM Mountain Pose
Desc: Stand tall in HM Mountain Pose, engage core and quadriceps by drawing knees slightly bent, maintaining balance and stability.

Title: HM Butt Kickers
Desc: "Hold a plank position, lift one leg towards glutes, and swiftly lower it back down without touching the ground. Repeat on the other side."

Title: HM Right-Leg Lunge And Kick-Out
Desc: Stand with feet hip-width apart, take a large step forward with right foot and lower body until back knee almost touches ground. Push back up to standing, then lift right leg out to the side for quadriceps engagement.

Title: HM Sumo Get-Up
Desc: "Start in a sumo stance, engage quadriceps by lowering body towards floor. From this position, explosively get-up to standing, keeping knees bent and core engaged."

Title: AM Jump Squat
Desc: The jump squat is an explosive bodyweight exercise targeting the quads, hamstrings, and glutes. It is also a serious cardiovascular challenge when done for reps. It can be performed as a power exercise to build jumping power, or in any fat-loss or athleticism-focused workout.

Title: AM Bodyweight Squat
Desc: The bodyweight squat is a fundamental exercise that strengthens the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can be performed as part of a dynamic warm-up, for time or reps during a workout, or for hip and spine mobility any time.

Title: High knees sprawl drill
Desc: The high knees sprawl drill is a full-body, cardio and strength-focused exercise. It can be performed for reps or time in a fast-paced circuit or other workout.

Title: UP Bulgarian Split Squat
Desc: The dumbbell Bulgaria split squat is a single-leg exercise targeting the quads, glutes, and hamstrings.

Title: UN Forward Lunge
Desc: Stand tall, take a large step forward with one foot and lower body until back knee almost touches ground. Push through front heel to return to standing.

Title: UN Front Foot Elevated Split Squat
Desc: "Stand on one foot, lift other heel off ground, and lower into a lunge-like position. Keep front knee bent at 90° and back straight. Push through front heel to return to standing."

Title: UNS Half-Kneeling Hip Flexor Stretch
Desc: "Start in a half-kneeling position, with one knee bent and the other extended. Lean forward, stretching the quadriceps and maintaining tension for 30 seconds."

Title: UNS Low Depth Jump
Desc: "Drop into a quarter squat, then explosively jump up to minimize depth, landing softly on midfoot. Quickly repeat, engaging quadriceps and developing power."

Title: UNS Forward-To-Reverse Lunge
Desc: "Stand with feet hip-width apart, take a large step forward with one foot. Lower your body until back knee almost touches ground, then push back to start. Alternate legs."

Title: Holman Towel Squat Thrust
Desc: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, engage core and lower body, then explosively thrust hips forward while keeping legs straight, emphasizing quadriceps contraction.

Title: Holman Towel Alternating Prisoner Squat
Desc: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, engage core and alternate squats while holding towels at shoulders, focusing on quadriceps activation.

Title: Holman Towel Alternating Lateral Lunge
Desc: Stand tall, engage core. Alternate lunging with one foot while keeping other lifted and straight, emphasizing quadriceps contraction.

Title: Holman Squat Pull-Through Jump
Desc: "Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, then lower into a squat and pull your knees back towards your chest. Quickly jump up, extending legs fully; repeat in rapid succession."

Title: Holman 180 Jump
Desc: "Jump high, landing softly on both feet, explosively extending quadriceps to absorb impact, while maintaining balance and control throughout."

Title: Holman Foot-Elevated Knee-Up to Squat
Desc: "Stand on one foot, elevate other knee towards armpit. Perform a squat while keeping lifted leg in place, then stand and repeat."

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Squat Thrust
Desc: Stand with feet elevated on floor, engage quadriceps and slowly lower body until thighs parallel to ground.

Title: Holman Hands-Elevated Lunge Jump
Desc: Stand with feet hip-width apart, elevate hands overhead, and jump into a lunge position, keeping back knee almost touching ground to engage quadriceps.

Title: Holman Hands-Elevated Jack to Split Jump
Desc: Start in a squat position, then explosively jump into a split stance, elevating your hands above your head. Lower back down, repeating the sequence with controlled quickness.

Title: Holman Hands-Elevated Wide Squat Thrust
Desc: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, hands elevated above shoulders. Lower body down into a wide squat, keeping hands near ears, then explosively thrust back up to starting position.

Title: Holman Hands-Elevated Squat Thrust to Split Jack
Desc: Start in a standing position, then lower into a squat and immediately thrust your hands on the ground. From there, explosively jump into a split stance, engaging quadriceps.

Title: Holman Squat Jump
Desc: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, then lower into a squat and explosively jump up, using quadriceps to propel yourself. Land softly and repeat.

Title: Holman Squat Pulse
Desc: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, then pulse into a squat while keeping knees bent at 90 degrees, emphasizing quadriceps contraction.

Title: Holman Jump-Out Push-Up
Desc: "Start in a plank position, engage quadriceps by bending one knee towards chest, then explosively extend leg back to start. Alternate legs for each repetition."

Title: Holman Alternating Forward Lunge
Desc: Stand with feet hip-width apart, take a large step forward with one foot and lower your body until back knee almost touches ground. Alternate legs with each rep.

Title: Holman Burpee to Jump
Desc: "Start in a squat position, jump up, and immediately perform a burpee. Quickly return to squat position, then explosively jump again."

Title: Holman Pilates Single-Leg Stretch
Desc: "Lie on back, lift one leg towards ceiling. Engage core and slowly lower leg behind you, keeping quadriceps tight. Focus on control as you stretch the opposite leg."

Title: Holman Alternating Reverse Prisoner Lunge
Desc: Stand with feet hip-width apart, engage core, and perform alternating lunges, keeping back knee almost touching ground, while targeting quadriceps.

Title: Holman Narrow-Wide Squat Jump to 180 Jump
Desc: "Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, then perform a narrow squat. Quickly transition to a wide squat and explosively jump up to 180 degrees, landing softly on both feet."

Title: Holman 180 Jump to Lunge
Desc: "Jump into a lunge position, extending opposite leg behind. Quickly switch legs while keeping back straight and knees bent."

Title: Holman Imaginary Jump Rope
Desc: "Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, then explosively lift one leg as if jumping rope, keeping knee straight. Quickly return to start and repeat."

Title: Holman Fast Feet with Hands Up
Desc: Stand with feet hip-width apart, hands up overhead and fast-twitch muscles engaged. Quickly alternate footwork while keeping knees bent and weight in quadriceps, maintaining tension throughout movement.

Title: Holman Hands-Elevated Alternating Lunge Jump
Desc: "Stand with feet hip-width apart, lift one foot off ground. Alternate jumping legs while elevating hands above head, targeting quadriceps."

Title: Holman Right Split Lunge
Desc: Stand with feet wide apart, step right foot forward into a lunge position, keeping back straight and front knee bent at 90 degrees. Lower body down until back knee almost touches ground, then push back up to starting position.

Title: Holman Left Split Lunge
Desc: Stand with feet wide apart, take a large step forward with one foot, and lower body until back knee almost touches ground, engaging quadriceps.

Title: Holman Plyometric Jump
Desc: Start in a squat position, then explosively jump up, landing softly on the balls of your feet. Immediately jump again, training quadriceps strength and power.

Title: Holman Quad Touch Jump
Desc: Drop down into a quarter squat, explosively extending your legs to jump up and touch your toes. Quickly return to the squat position, repeating the motion.

Title: Holman Skate
Desc: "From a lunge position, slide one foot forward while keeping the other back, lowering body until front knee forms a 90-degree angle. Push back to start."

Title: Holman Lunge Jump
Desc: "Start in a lunge position, jump forward while keeping front knee bent and rear leg extended. Quickly switch legs, repeating the movement."

Title: Holman Flying Squat Thrust
Desc: "Start in a standing position, then drop into a squat and place hands on ground. Kick back into a plank position, engaging quads before quickly returning to stand."

Title: Holman 90-Degree Jump
Desc: "Drop into a lunge position, keeping back knee almost touching ground. Then, explosively jump up while straightening front leg, landing softly on balls of feet to target quadriceps."

Title: Holman Half Jack to 180 Jump
Desc: "Jump into a lunge position, then explosively swing leg up and forward, keeping knee bent at 90 degrees. Quickly reverse direction, landing softly on the same leg."

Title: Holman Quick Feet to Quad Touch Jump
Desc: "Drop into a quarter squat, explosively jump up and quickly tap your hands to your quadriceps. Land softly and immediately repeat, emphasizing rapid movement."

Title: Holman Squat Thrust to Push-Up to Super Woman
Desc: "From a standing position, perform a squat thrust, then push up into a plank. Quickly switch legs and repeat, engaging quadriceps throughout."

Title: Holman Plyometric Jump to 180 Jump
Desc: "Explode into a squat position, then quickly extend knees and hips to jump vertically. Rotate 180° while airborne, landing softly on both feet with knees bent."

Title: Holman Standing Heel Click to Hands Down Heel Click
Desc: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, heels lifted and hands grasping toes. Slowly lower heels toward ground, then quickly click back up to starting position, engaging quadriceps throughout.

Title: Holman Burpee to 180 Jump
Desc: Perform a burpee, then explosively jump up and rotate your body to land in a squat position, engaging quadriceps to control the movement.

Title: Holman Traveling Low Jack to Belly Touch
Desc: Start in a plank position, then engage quadriceps by bringing one knee forward while keeping other leg straight. Quickly switch legs and touch belly with each rep.

Title: Holman Flying Squat Thrust to Shoulder Tap
Desc: "Start in a squat position, then explosively drive knees forward while tapping shoulders. Quick turnover and powerful movement engage quadriceps."

Title: Holman Squat Jump to Alternating Side Lunge Jump
Desc: "From a standing position, descend into a squat. Then, explosively jump to an alternating side lunge, landing softly on the ball of one foot before immediately jumping back to standing."

Title: Holman Low Squat with Low Diagonal Dumbbell Punch
Desc: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, sink into a low squat. Punch diagonally with one arm while keeping the other straight, engaging quadriceps and maintaining proper form.

Title: Holman Right Leg Hop to Right Reverse Lunge
Desc: Hop forward on right leg, keeping knee bent, then immediately transition into a reverse lunge on same leg, lowering body until back knee almost touches ground.

Title: Holman Left Leg Hop to Left Reverse Lunge
Desc: "Hop forward with your left leg, then slide into a reverse lunge, keeping your back knee almost touching the ground. Focus on extending your front quadriceps."

Title: Holman Burpee to Open Stance
Desc: "Start in open stance, drop into a squat position with hands near feet. Quickly kick back into plank, jump forward, and explosively stand up, targeting quadriceps."

Title: Holman Diagonal Squat Thrust to Renegade Forward Punch
Desc: "Start in a plank position, then drop down into a squat, placing hands on ground. Quickly thrust legs straight out, followed by a forward punch with same-side hand."

Title: Holman Bear Crawl
Desc: Bear crawl forward, engaging quadriceps, with knees slightly bent and hands near shoulders, moving slowly and controlled.

Title: Holman Bear Crawl to Donkey Kick
Desc: Start in a bear crawl position, hands and feet shoulder-width apart. Lower body towards ground, keeping knees bent at 90 degrees. Quickly transition into a donkey kick, lifting back leg towards ceiling. Alternate legs for added quadriceps challenge.

Title: Holman Bear Crawl to Froggy Push-Up
Desc: "Start in a bear crawl position, then lower into a frog-like stance and immediately perform a push-up, engaging quadriceps and building strength."

Title: Holman Bear Crawl to Shoulder Tap
Desc: Start in a bear crawl position, arms and legs bent, then lift left arm to tap shoulder while keeping right leg straight. Repeat on the other side.

Title: Holman Burpee to Tuck Jump
Desc: "Start in a plank position, drop into a burpee, then explosively jump up and tuck knees towards chest, engaging quadriceps for maximum strength."

Title: Holman Burpee to Flying Squat Thrust to Tuck Jump
Desc: "Start in a squat, then explosively thrust into a jump, landing softly on the balls of your feet and immediately tucking your knees up to engage quadriceps."

Title: Holman Forward Lunge to Reverse Lunge
Desc: Perform a Holman Forward Lunge, stepping forward with one foot and lowering body until knee is bent at 90 degrees. Quickly switch legs, executing a Reverse Lunge on the other side.

Title: Holman Renegade Lunge Jump
Desc: "Stand with feet hip-width apart, then jump into a lunge position. Lower your body until back knee almost touches ground, then explosively jump up, landing softly on the same foot."

Title: Holman Squat Jump to Lunge Jump
Desc: Stand with feet hip-width apart, then descend into a squat and explosively jump up, immediately transitioning into a lunge position, emphasizing quadricep contraction.

Title: Holman Prisoner Reverse Lunge
Desc: Stand with feet hip-width apart, take a large step back with one foot and slowly lower body until back knee almost touches ground, keeping front thigh parallel to ground.

Title: Holman Wide-to-Narrow Squat Jump
Desc: "Stand with feet wide apart, then quickly transition to narrow stance. Lower into a squat, explosively jumping up while straightening legs and hips."

Title: Holman Donkey Run
Desc: "Start on all fours, engage core and lift one leg towards your head while keeping other foot grounded. Alternate legs in a slow, controlled motion."

Title: Holman Weighted Wide-to-Narrow Squat Jump
Desc: From a standing position, squat wide, then swiftly switch to a narrow stance and explosively jump up, engaging quadriceps.

Title: Holman Wide-to-Narrow Donkey Kick
Desc: "Start on all fours, lift one leg out to the side, keeping foot flexed. Slowly lower and raise, targeting quadriceps."

Title: Holman Mule Kick
Desc: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, lift one leg forward and extend, keeping knee straight. Quickly switch legs, targeting quadriceps strength.

Title: Holman Goal Post to Squat
Desc: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, then lunge forward and sink into a squat as if trying to reach for something behind your front foot, keeping knees bent at 90 degrees.

Title: Holman Frogger Squat to Heel Click
Desc: "Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, then lower into a squat. As you descend, extend one leg backwards and click your heel on the ground before returning to standing."

Title: Holman Stair Sprint
Desc: "Quickly sprint up stairs using only your quadriceps to propel you, engaging the muscles as you descend and ascend."

Title: Holman Stair Bear Crawl
Desc: "From a plank position, bear crawl up stairs (or steps) using only your quadriceps to lift and move, engaging core for stability."

Title: Holman Burpee to Flying Squat Thrust
Desc: "Start in a standing position, drop down into a squat then kick back into a plank. Quickly do a push-up and bring your knees up to your chest. Jump feet forward and stand up, immediately dropping into a flying squat thrust."

Title: Holman Flying Squat Thrust to Push-Up
Desc: "Start in a squat, then explosively drive through heels and push into a plank position. Transfer weight from arms to shoulders before performing a push-up."

Title: Holman Foot-Elevated Step-To-Lunge
Desc: Step forward with one foot elevated on a surface, keeping knee straight. Lower into lunge position, then push back up to starting position, engaging quadriceps throughout.

Title: Holman Split Lunge
Desc: Stand tall, lift one leg forward while keeping knee bent at 90 degrees and lowering body towards ground. Push back up to starting position, alternating legs.

Title: Holman Stair Climb
Desc: Find a staircase and ascend using body weight only, focusing on quadricep engagement to climb each step smoothly.

Title: Holman Burpee to Flying Jack
Desc: "Start in a squat position, then explosively jump up and land softly on the balls of your feet. Quickly drop into a plank, immediately following with a flying jack leg lift."

Title: Holman Right Reverse Lunge
Desc: Stand with feet hip-width apart, take a large step back with one foot, and lower body until back knee almost touches ground. Push through front heel to return to standing position.

Title: Holman Left Reverse Lunge
Desc: Perform a left reverse lunge, stepping back with your left foot and lowering your body until your right knee almost touches the ground. Push through your front heel to return to standing.

Title: Holman Squat Tap to Hop
Desc: "Start in a squat position, then quickly tap one foot and hop forward, targeting quadriceps. Quickly repeat on other side."

Title: Holman Squat Tap to Jump-Forward-Jump-Back
Desc: "Start in a squat position, then tap feet together and explosively jump forward. Quickly reverse direction, landing softly on the balls of your feet."

Title: Holman Squat Hip Drive
Desc: "Start in a squat position, engage core and glutes. Drive hips back and forward, emphasizing quadricep contraction. Repeat smoothly, maintaining proper form."

Title: Holman Alternating Double Lunge Hop
Desc: "Alternate between stepping forward and backward into a lunge, immediately hopping back to start. Focus on quadricep engagement and control throughout the movement."

Title: Holman Right Reverse Lunge to Front Kick
